Louza and her family live in the Shoe factory community, Gardnerville north of Monrovia, but she work at the Bernerville junction, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Louza is a graduate of the teacher’s college and a freshman in a University in Monrovia.  Her business is selling cosmetics. She sells cosmetics like roll-on, bath soap, body lotions, powder, and tooth paste to residents of Bernerville. She has been running this business for 3 years, and hoping to improve to a wholesaler and have branches around Monrovia,Liberia.

Louza talks to her customers in a good manner and her cosmetics are cheap in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business.  She started selling with savings from her daycare center and decided to build a shop.  Now, she needs a loan to improve business.

Louza dreams of giving her children, niece and nephew better education to prepare them for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and charcoal

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. Two are in junior high school whilest the rest are still in elementary school. He is very hard-working and supportive to his wife in providing food and shelter for their household. He looks smallish but is grown in age. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits, etc., in his neighborhood.

James also owns a cocoa farm in the community. With the loan, he wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc., to expand his inventory. He hopes to increase his savings to support his wife in taking care of the home and their children's educational needs. He has been in this business for eight years now.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 37 years old. He is married and has four children. All his children are in school. He is very hard-working and supportive to his wife in providing food and shelter for their household. He is a professional and teaches in the community basic school. He and his wife own and operate a grocery shop and sell items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits, etc. in his neighborhood. He takes delivery of goods from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

With the loan, Emmanuel wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. in bulk. He hopes to increase his savings to support his wife in taking care of the home and their children's educational needs. He is been in this business for seven years now.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: Agya

texts.en:
Agya is 35 years old. He is married with two children. Currently both his children are in school. He is a chemicals seller and sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonics, pain killers, malaria drugs, etc. in his neighborhood. He has been in business for nine years now and he is among the few people or licensed chemical shops who supply pharmaceutical products in the community. His chemical shop is registered and has the right to operate by Ghana pharmaceutical council.

Agya wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of drugs to include others that are frequently demanded by his customers. He hopes to make a good income to take care of his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 35 years old. She is a wife and mother of four kids. Currently all her children are in school. She enjoys selling goods, the business from which she makes a living. She has been selling yams for eight years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and would resell to her at higher price.

Lydia wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Currently, one of her children is in school, while her youngest child is too young to attend school. She lives in a community in the western region of Ghana.

To earn a living, she is a trader who deals assorted products such as cooking utensils, plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She generally sells her goods through "hawking" (i.e., house-to-house selling). She explains that she has been trading for three years now. With her good humor and kind demeanor she has attracted many loyal customers who purchase goods from her stand. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Recently, she added food sales during lunch time to her business operations. Specifically, she prepares and serves banku with tilapia. Banku, which is a delicacy prepared from milled maize and includes hot sauce or pepper, is enjoyed by many people of Ghana.

She has been facing challenges with her business as a result of inadequate funds, which precludes her from purchasing additional inventory. As a result, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to buy more supplies of products that are frequently in high demand. With the loan proceeds she believes she will be better positioned to generate higher profits in order to, ultimately, build her own store (and thereby do away with the need to sell her products by "hawking"). She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 26 years old. She is married and the mother of two children, who are in school. She prepares and serves beverages in the morning in the community where she lives. She supports her children from the proceeds she makes from the business. Mary mostly uses cocoa drink to serve her customers because of its nutritional value. She requests for the loan to buy stock like milk, bread, eggs, etc., to meet the demand of her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tea bags, tin of Milo, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is 26 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Currently one is in school, while the last born is still breastfeeding. She sponsors the children's education, health care and food, etc., through the support from the husband and the business. She is a bread baker and has been baking for four years now. She bakes and supplies to her customers, and also sells the rest through hawking in the community market where she lives.  She acquired her baking skills from baking school. She has good customer relations; for that reason, lots of customers buy from her. She requests the loan assistance to enable her procure stock like flour, flavor, nut milk, baking powder, etc. She takes delivery of stock in bulk from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She believes sales could increase as we enter Christmas and she would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy items like flour, flavor, baking powder etc.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu B., a 23-year-old single woman from Wilberforce (an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone). Isatu has one child, a girl, who is one year old. She has been a client of LAPO for some time now, and has taken out two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPO union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu has a shop in Lumley market in Freetown, from which she sells soap paste and creams. With her first two loans, she expanded the inventory of her shop. With her new loan, Isatu decided to buy more stock of the same types of goods. Isatu hopes her latest LAPO loan will allow her to move forward to an increased profit and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: purchase additional inventory of soap and cosmetics

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi is 28 years old. He is married with a child who is in nursery school. Kofi has been a professional carpenter for the past five years. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture. He said because of a lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This, he said, slows down his work because he has to wait for funds from his customers before any work can begin, which most often causes delays. He requests the loan to enable him to procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sand paper, wood, etc., to improve on his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income status to ensure a good living for his family. He would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She is a very hard-working woman whose hard effort provides for the children, all of whom are in school. She trades in food stuffs like maize and gari grains. She sells maize in bulk in the market. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. She takes delivery of stock from the nearby communities, and distributes or treks them during market days. She has a large customer base but her problem is inadequate funds to buy stock. With the loan assistance, she believes she can be fully resourced to realize her dream of providing better education for her children. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy cereals like gari and maize grains.

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en: Mamuna is a 20-year-old young lady. She is married and the mother of one child. She is currently in school and is a very hard-working trader. She enjoys selling and cosmetics sales has been her major source of livelihood for the past three years. She says selling of cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers and market acceptance. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she sells on top of a table in the community market and sometimes through hawking. She believes that with the loan, she would be more resourced to purchase more stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory, and income for that matter.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetic products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 49 years old. She is divorced and a mother with four children, who are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling cereals like beans, maize and groundnut cereals in the community market to her loyal customers. She says selling of these products is very lucrative and with her 11 years of selling experience, she believes her dream could come true. She takes delivery of stock from Techiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to support her family, especially in their education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut, maize and beans

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is 27 years old. He is married with a child who is still breastfeeding from its mother. 'Mathew the fisher', as he is popularly called by his peers, has been a professional carpenter for some years now. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture. He has one apprentice who is learning skills and training for his future career. He has been in business for the last six years now. He said because of a lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This, he said, slows down his work because he has to wait for funds from his customers before any work can begin, which most often causes delays. He requests the loan to enable him procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sand paper, wood, etc., to improve on his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income status to ensure a good living for his family. He would grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 23 years old. She is married but has no children. She is a trader in jeans, clothes, blouse, skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She says her working capital was provided by her husband, but has not been adequate for her business. She has been in business for the last three years now and is not able to purchase high-quality products. Florence believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality items in large quantities to scale up sales. For Christmas, she knows adequate funds can boost her stock with variety and hence, increased profit. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, clothes, ladies' wear and slippers to increase her inventory. She would be glad and grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, clothes, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Saio

texts.en:
This is Saio K., a 32-year-old married woman from Wilberforce (an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone). Saio has two children, one boy and one girl, both of whom attend primary school; her husband a mechanic in Freetown. She has been a client of LAPO for some time now, and has taken out one previous loan. She is a member of a LAPO union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders. 

Saio sells her goods by walking in Freetown. She sells caustic soda (a product used by many Sierra Leoneans to make soap and cleaning supplies) and palm oil. With her first loan, she expanded her inventory of the same goods. With her new loan, Saio hopes to increase her profits again by expanding the inventory of current products.

loans.use: Purchase additional supplies of palm oil and caustic soda for sale

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en: Barikisu is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of nine children. Six are currently in school. She is a resourceful mother who also works very hard to provide food and support for her business. She is a petty trader and sells in the community market square; she enjoys selling, a business through which she makes a living. Barikisu sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, smoked fish, etc., on top of a table in the market. She takes stock of goods from the Kumasi central market, which is a nearby city, and her surrounding communities for the vegetables. She is requesting the loan to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsa tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y madre de 04 hijos: 02 varones y 02 mujeres, estudió hasta 5to. grado de primaria, vive en el  Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Hace 06 meses integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró 04 ovinos. Doña Elsa empezó a vender desde los 10 años de edad (galletas, dulces, frutas, abarrotes), a los 18 años de edad se casó, junto con su esposo se dedica desde entonces al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, ovino, porcino.

Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 02 ovinos con 240.00 nuevos soles y 03 porcinos con 240.00 nuevos soles.

Su mayor sueño es cambiar de negocio, ella dice que le gustaría instalar una tienda de abarrotes, así poder dedicarse más a sus hijos y poder ayudarlos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa is 35 years old, is married, and is a mother with 4 children: 2 boys and 2 girls. She studied through the 5th grade of primary school. She lives in the district of llave, the Province of El Collao, in the Department of Puno, Perú. 6 months ago she joined the Communal Bank "Jesus of Nazareth," and with her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles (Peruvian money - $115 US) she bought 4 sheep. Elsa began selling products at 10 years of age (cookies, candies, fruits, groceries). She married at age 18, and since then together with her husband she has been in the business of buying and selling cattle, sheep, and pigs. With the credit of 500.00 nuevos soles ($175) she will buy: 2 sheep with 240.00 nuevos soles and 3 pigs with 240.00 nuevos soles. Her greatest dream is to open a different business. She would like to start a grocery store, and thereby be able to dedicate herself more to her children and help them become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 sheep and 2 pigs

loans.name: Salvadora Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora M. es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado mantener su pulpería haciéndola crecer poco a poco a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo. Ella habita en el departamento de León y a diario abre la pulpería desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Es importante destacar que ella viaja dos veces a la semana al mercado de la capital para realizar las compras y de esta manera continuar generando ingresos para el mantenimiento de su negocio y de su familia que depende de ella.
texts.en:
Salvadora M. is a hard-working person who has managed to keep her small general store growing little by little as time has gone by. She lives in the department of León and she opens her store for business every day from very early in the morning until nightfall. It is important to stress that she travels twice a week to the market in the capital to buy supplies to continue generating income to support her business and her family that depends on her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, sugar, ramen noodles, chicken, and beans

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal del departamento de León, la señora Ofelia del Carmen L. se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa la que es comercializada por ella misma vendiendo todo tipo de ropa en su establecimiento que aunque no presta las condiciones necesarias para la actividad, ella se esfuerza para realizar sus ventas acá.

Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la mercadería como lo es la ropa para viajar a la capital y comprarla y de esta manera comercializarla en su establecimiento para seguir buscando la manera de mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
At the Terminal Market in the department of León, Sra. Ofelia del Carmen L. sells different types of clothing from her establishment. However, her location does not provide the necessary conditions for her business, but she still strives to make sales.

She is requesting a loan so that she can go to the capital to buy merchandise and bring it back to her establishment to sell. This will enable her to improve the financial condition of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Adenike Marguerite

texts.fr: K. Adenike Marguerite est née le 20 Juillet 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Adenike Marguerite est mariée à GANTOUNGBE Georges, un agent du Centre National de la Sécurité Sociale (CNSS). Le couple a quatre enfants en charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants et sont scolarisés. C’est depuis onze ans que Adenike Marguerite  vit à Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou, avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Seul le conjoint, Georges, supporte les charges de la famille. Depuis six ans de cela, Adenike Marguerite vend des plastiques, bassines, poudre, eau de toilette et également de la boisson alcoolisée locale (« Sodabi ») et des sachets de « Pur Water » à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Adenike Marguerite fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé capitale du Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Adenike Marguerite est à son deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit qu’elle a eu de ALIDé a été bien remboursé. C’est pour accroître son activité et attirer plus la clientèle que Adenike Marguerite sollicite ce deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Adenike Marguerite was born on July 20, 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to GANTOUNGBE Georges, an agent of the Centre National de la Sécurité Sociale (CNSS).  The couple has four children to support.  Three of them are their own and in school.  For eleven years, Adenike Marguerite has been living in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, with her children and husband.  Her husband Georges is the only one covering family expenses. For six years, Adenike Marguerite has been selling plasticware, tubs, powder, eau de toilette, and also a local alcoholic drink (sodabi), and pouches of "Pur Water" out of her home and by the distribution system.  She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She is on her second loan.  The first one she had with ALIDé was repaid.  To grow her business and to attract more customers, she's requesting this second ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 dozen plastic items, 2 containers of "sodabi", and 20 dozen pouches of "Pur Water"

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, desde hace cuarenta años  la señora Maritza O. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son comercializadas por ella misma todos los días desde las cuatro de la mañana.
El negocio lo heredó de su mamá habiendo aprendido de ella la manera en que se elaboran las tortillas. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para continuar elaborando las riquísimas tortillas y así mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por su hijo y su mamá a la que tiene que mantener por su avanzada edad.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Sra. Maritza O. has been dedicated to her business of making and selling tortillas for 40 years. She sells her products every day starting at 4am.

Maritza inherited this business from her mother, who taught her how to make tortillas. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy ingredients so that she can continue producing her delicious products. This will enable her to support her family, which consists of her son and her elderly mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making tortillas

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a supplier of building cement. He takes delivery of stock from Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. He serves as a wholesaler and retailer to the surrounding communities. Joseph is 45 years old, married and the father of four children. All his children are in school in the community where they live. He requests loan assistance to buy cement in bulk to limit his frequent traveling. With support, he will be adequately resourced for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy a supply of building cement to sell

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. In addition to that, she also sells onions, spices and peppers on a tabletop. She is 40 years old and a wife with two children. Her husband is a trader. With her hard work, all her children are in school. She considers this a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el caballero José María A. se dedica a laborar con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar y suplir las necesidades de su casa y familia compuesta por su esposa e hijos. 

Es importante destacar que él tiene mucho conocimiento en el ramo de las computadoras y trabaja fuertemente porque necesita realizar compras de electrodomésticos para su hogar porque los necesita para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y así suplir todas las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
José María A. lives in the department of León and works very hard in order to provide sustenance to his home and meet the needs of his home and family, made up of his wife and children. It is important to stress that he has very good computer skills and works hard to buy needed home appliances to provide better living conditions for his family and thus meet his home's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a local supplier of palm fruits and palm oil. She is also a petty trader selling in the community market square. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, smoked fishes, etc. on a tabletop in the market. She gets stock from the Kumasi Central Market which is in a nearby city and vegetables from the surrounding communities.

Palm oil is produced from palm nuts fruit. The palm fruit is processed through various stages to obtain palm oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries as well as local soaps. Abena supplies palm oil to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to buy stock in bulk. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of palm fruits and other foodstuffs.

Abena is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. One of her children attends school but she could not send the others to school; they are now learning a trade. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil, palm nuts fruit, etc.

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: D. Geneviève est née le 14 Mai 1977 à Athiémé à proximité de la frontière du Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Geneviève est mariée à AMEGNIKOU Daniel, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Geneviève vit depuis huit ans avec son conjoint et ses enfants au quartier Hèdomey à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Geneviève vient en aide à son mari Daniel dans les charges de la famille. Geneviève n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a quatre ans de cela que Geneviève vend de la liqueur locale (communément appelée « sodabi ») et aussi de la nourriture (haricot) dans sa baraque à son domicile. Geneviève fait ses achats à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Adja dans le Mono au Bénin. Geneviève a déjà obtenu de ALIDé un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. En vue d’augmenter la taille de son activité et de vendre davantage ses produits, Geneviève sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Geneviève was born on May 14, 1977 in Athiémé, near the border of Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She is married to AMEGNIKOU Daniel, a chauffeur.  The couple has four children, some of whom are in school.  For eight years, Geneviève has been living with her husband and children in the Hèdomey district in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. She comes to her husband Daniel's aid to meet family expenses.  Geneviève has never been to school.  For four years, she has been selling a local liquor (commonly called sodabi) and also food (beans) in her stall at her home.  She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also from Adja in Mono, in Benin.  She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid.  With the aim of expanding her business and selling more goods, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 drums of local liquor, 3 sacks of beans, and 3 drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Julia Catalina

texts.en:
Julia Catalina R. F. is 60 years old and lives in a cane home with her husband in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil.  The couple has four children. They are all older and independent. About 16 years ago, Ms. R. began selling chickens. She started with four chickens and now she has around 25.  She buys the young chickens for 70 cents and spends 6-8 weeks feeding and caring for them.  When they are fully grown, Ms. R. is able to sell each for $1.25/lb.  

Ms. R. is requesting a loan in order to buy more chickens and chicken feed.  The holidays are approaching and chicken sales go up for Christmas and New Years.  Therefore, Ms. R. wants to be ready with an ample supply.  In the future, she wishes to fix and secure her home.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Cipriano Justino

texts.es:
En el departamento de León el señor Cipriano C. se destaca por tener su negocio de venta de llantas, filtros y aceite para vehículos en su propio establecimiento donde a diario vende estos productos a sus clientes que le visitan. Al negocio le ha puesto por nombre Vulcanización Venceremos y también presta los servicios de cambio de aceite y lavado para el vehículo.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas, aceite y filtro para el vehículo con la finalidad de ofrecerlos en su local y así generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo para salir adelante y desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Cipriano C. sells automobile tires, filters and lubricants from his own business, located in the department of León, to his customers who daily visit him to make their purchases. His business is called Vulcanización Venceremos and he also provides vehicle services like oil change and car wash. He is requesting financing to buy automobile lubricants, tires and filters to offer for sale so that he can generate income to support his family which so depends on him to get ahead and develop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy automobile lubricants, tires and filters.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: G. Delphine est née le 10 Septembre 1978 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Delphine est mariée à MEDIN Mathieu, un mécanicien auto. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Delphine vit ensemble depuis quatre ans avec ses enfants et son mari à Hèdomey à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Delphine a arrêté les classes au cours primaire. Depuis 3 ans, Delphine mène comme activité, la vente de divers en gros (boîtes d’allumettes, lait, savons, etc.) au marché de Cococodji et de Cocotomey, deux villes situées à proximité de Cotonou. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Delphine fait ses approvisionnements. Delphine a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Pour accroître son activité et gagner une grande part de marché, Delphine sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Delphine was born on September 10, 1978 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin.  She is married to Mr. MEDIN Mathieu, an auto mechanic.  The couple has two children who are both in school.  For four years, Delphine has been living together with her children and husband in the Hèdomey district in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.   Delphine stopped going to classes in primary school.  For three years, she has been running a wholesale business selling a variety of goods (boxes of matches, milk, soaps, etc.) at the markets in Cocotomey and Cococodji, two cities located near Cotonou.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she goes to stock up.  She has benefited from an ALIDé loan before, which she has repaid.  To grow her business and to win a large market share, she's requesting a second ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 8 boxes of soaps and 6 boxes of matches

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.en:
Fidelina is a single mother who has eight grown children, all of whom are independent except for her youngest daughter. 
Fidelina has survived many hardships, raising her eight children alone after her partner left her. For many years, she worked in the market selling vegetables and fruit that her father grew in his small orchard next to their house. 
She worked at the market for almost 30 years, working every day, seven days a week, beginning her day at 4am and ending at 3pm, after selling all her produce. 
Later, her sons began to help when they were grown. She sold her spot in the market and used the money from the sale to set up a pantry from her home. She now owns her own business and has a lot of very good clients. 
Fidelina is very grateful for the opportunities she has had in life to achieve her goal of operating a pantry. She loves her business so much she does not plan to stop working any time soon. 
Fidelina will use the loan to buy a greater variety of merchandise so that she can meet the demand for products that her customers have.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Béranger

texts.fr: K. Béranger est née le 26 Mai 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Béranger est mariée à DOSSOU-YOVO Luc, un dépaneur. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. C’est depuis 15 ans que Béranger vit à Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Béranger n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Béranger vend depuis cinq ans déjà, des chaussures, des sacs et parfois des tissus de façon ambulante. Béranger fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Béranger a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé qu’elle a bien remboursé. En vue d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et sa part de marché, Béranger sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Béranger K. was born on 26 May, 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Béranger is married to Luc Dossou-Yovo, a repairman. The couple have two children, both in school. For 15 years, Béranger has lived in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou. The household expenses are met by both husband and wife. Béranger never went to school. To provide for herself and for her children, Béranger has been selling shoes, bags, and sometimes fabric door-to-door for the past five years. Béranger gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Lomé, Togo, a country bordering Benin. Béranger has already benefited from one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. In order to increase her sales and market share, Béranger is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three dozen pairs of shoes and two dozen bags

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Bárbara vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente, ellos tienen 2 hijos, pero éstos ya tienen sus propias familias y radican en otros lugares.

Ella adecuó un espacio de su vivienda para vender comida y bebidas (sólo menú). Se decidió por este negocio debido a que está ubicada frente a una empresa constructora de yates, siendo los trabajadores de esta fábrica quienes acuden a degustar de su buena sazón. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 y lo que más le gusta es preparar platos al gusto de sus comensales y que éstos se sientan satisfechos.
Para el futuro, como un negocio adicional, le gustaría vender zapatos.

Con MFP ya tiene 14 préstamos y lo que más le de su banco  comunal es sus compañeros son personas muy trabajadoras y solidarias, además se entretiene mucho durante las reuniones de grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina, mesas y sillas; también adquirirá comestibles para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Bárbara lives with her husband, who is a sales clerk. They have two children who have their own families and live elsewhere. She modified a space in her house to sell prepared meals and beverages (menú only - a kind of prix-fixe, 2 or 3 course meal). She decided to go into this kind of occupation because she lives across from a yacht-building business and it is the employees of this place that love to eat her meals. She has had this occupation for the past 15 years and what she most likes about it is preparing dishes that her diners enjoy and that insures they leave satisfied. For the future, as an additional line of work, she would like to sell shoes. She has had 14 loans with MFP and what she most likes about her communal bank are her fellow members, who are very hard-working and cooperative. Besides, she enjoys the group meetings very much. The funds requested this time will be used to buy kitchen utensils, tables and chairs; she will also buy ingredients with which to prepare her meals

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and utensils.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 50 años, vive junto a su esposo, sus  dos hijos, sus dos nietos y su hermano. 
Desde hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de jugos y sándwiches, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad, donde ya cuenta con clientes fieles quienes no dejan de ir a consumir sus jugos desde muy tempranas horas. Su rutina diaria empieza a las 5 de la mañana y termina antes del medio día. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes, además que se mantiene ocupada, y sobre todo se entretiene. 
Por otro lado, considera que le es muy rentable porque todos sus productos (frutas, huevos, azúcar, etc.) lo compra en ese mismo mercado a bajos precios, está en una buena zona y tiene ingresos diarios.
Para el futuro, le gustaría alquilar un local adecuado para instalar su juguería.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y desde ya ha notado que las personas de su grupo son honestas, trabajadoras y sobre todo, responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a construir un kiosco más grande para su negocio, donde pueda tener mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Blanca is 50 years-old and lives with her husband, her two children, her two grandchildren, and her brother. For 17 years Blanca has been selling juices and sandwiches. She has a stand in her local market, where she has loyal customers who always come, starting early in the day, to purchase her juices. Blanca's daily routine beings at 5 in the morning and ends before noon. What she likes best about this job is providing good service to her customers, but it also keeps her busy and entertained. Also, Blanca considers this business very profitable because all her ingredients (fruits, eggs, sugar, etc) she buys in the same market at a low price. The stand is in a good location and provides daily income. In the future, Blanca would like to rent a store apt for selling her juices. This is her first loan with MFP, but the people in her group are honest, hard-working, and, above all, responsible. With the funds from this loan Blanca will build a bigger kiosk for her business, one where she will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bigger kiosk for her business

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela tiene 35 años, es madre de tres hijos, los cuales están estudiando. Vive con su pareja, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. La casa donde viven es de su tía.

Ella vende comida (caldo de gallina) fueras de su vivienda en un pequeño kiosco que le construyó su esposo, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años.
Sus más asiduos clientes son los colegas de su esposo, todos ellos dedicados al transporte de pasajeros, quienes acuden a consumir su comida todos los días, debido a su buen sabor y por su precio cómodo. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es llevarse bien con sus clientes y darles una buena atención, además le es rentable porque no es una actividad agotadora, trabaja por horas y sus ingresos son diarios y buenos.

Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, a ella le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque entre todos se llevan muy bien y son responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a refaccionar su kiosco, comprará mesas y sillas para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmela is 35 years-old and the mother of three children, who are currently studying. She lives with her partner, who works transporting passengers. The house they live in belongs to her aunt. Carmela sells food (chicken stock) outside her home in a small kiosk that her husband built. She has had this business for 3 years. Her most frequent customers are her husband's coworkers, who all work in the transportation industry. They come everyday to purchase her food because of its good taste and convenient price. What Carmela likes best about her job is getting along well with her customers and providing them good service. The business is also profitable because it is not very tiring. She can work for hours for a good, daily income. This is Carmela's 7th loan with MFP. She likes to be part of her communal bank because all the members get along well together and are very responsible with their payments. With the funds from this loan, Carmela will refurbish her kiosk and buy tables and chairs to provide better service to the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment of kiosk and purchase of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 27 años, es madre de un niño de un añito; vive junto a su pareja, quien es mecánico de maquinaria pesada, en la casa de su suegra.

Desde hace 6 meses empezó a criar pollos en un pequeño corral que adecuó en la huerta de su suegra, los cría al aire libre y son conocidos como los “pollos de chacra”, los cuales la gente prefiere por su crecimiento natural.
Lo que a Diana le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus animales para que tengan un buen peso y pueda obtener un precio justo; además es un negocio rentable porque son sus vecinos quienes le compran sus pollos constantemente, y cuando no los vende todos, prepara el tradicional “caldo de gallina” y lo vende afuera de su vivienda.
Diana está muy satisfecha con su actividad, también porque cuenta con el apoyo de su suegra y sus dos cuñadas. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas organizadas y muy trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más pollos bebé y suficiente alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
Diana is 27 years-old and the mother of an only one-year-old son. She lives with her partner, who is a heavy machinery mechanic, in her mother-in-law's house. Six months ago Diana began raising chickens in a small coop that she put up in her mother-in-law's garden. She raises the chickens outdoors so they are known as "farm chickens," which people prefer for their natural growth. What Diana likes about her job is raising the animals well so they reach a good weight and can be sold for a fair price. The business is profitable because the neighbors constantly buy chickens, and when Diana can't sell them all she prepares traditional chicken stock, which she sells outside of the home. Diana is very satisfied with this business, especially since she has the support of her mother-in-law and her two sisters-in-law. This is her second loan with MFP. Diana likes her communal bank because her fellow members are organized and very hard-working. With the funds from this loan she will buy more baby chickens and enough feed to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baby chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros; tienen una hija de 9 meses, y por el momento viven en una casa alquilada.

Para su negocio, un salón de belleza, alquiló un local hace 7 años y ahí realiza todo tipo de peinados, cortes de cabello, tintes, manicure y pedicure.
Lo que a Elsa le gusta de su trabajo es aprender lo último en moda y estar pendiente de las exigencias de sus clientes. También le es muy rentable porque su local se encuentra en una zona que es muy transitada, además cuenta con una gama de clientes regulares. Adicionalmente, Esla atiende a domicilio y así obtiene ingresos adicionales.

Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque le brindaron la oportunidad de seguir adelante en su negocio, a parte que sus compañeros son personas muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará productos de belleza y materiales para cortes de cabello. Con lo que le reste ambientará su local adecuadamente para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa is 27, and she lives with her husband. He works transporting passengers. They have a nine month old daughter. For the moment, they live in a rented house. Her business is a beauty salon. She rented the place seven years ago. She does all types of hairdos, cuts hair, does tints, manicures, and pedicures. What Elsa likes about her work is learning the latest style and to be devoted to her customers’ demands. It is also very profitable because her location is in a very busy area. Also, she has an assortment of regular customers. Additionally, Elsa gets additional income from taking care of customers in their homes. This is her second loan with MFP. She likes being part of her communal bank because it offers the opportunity to get ahead in her business, and her colleagues are very responsible people. She will use the money that she is asking for to buy beauty products and materials for cutting hair. She will use the rest to equip her place adequately in order to give her customers a better reception.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products and materials for her salon

loans.name: Ayaba Rosine

texts.fr: B. Ayaba Rosine est née le 11 Mars 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ayaba Rosine est mariée à BOKO Anselme, un mécanicien. Le couple à quatre enfants en charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent avec leurs parents. La famille vit depuis deux ans à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Ayaba Rosine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pour cela, Ayaba Rosine vend des divers (conserves, lait, sardines, mayonnaise, pâtes alimentaires, savons, couscous, papier hygiénique, huile végétale, etc.) dans sa boutique se trouvant dans son domicile. Ayaba Rosine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ayaba Rosine n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. Pour accroître davantage son activité et satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Ayaba Rosine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ayaba Rosine B. was born on 11 March, 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Ayaba Rosine is married to Anselme Boko, a mechanic. The couple have four children in their care, of whom three are their own. All of the children are in school and live with their parents. The family has lived in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, for two years. Ayaba Rosine came to the aid of her husband in providing for the family. For this, Ayaba Rosine sells various items (canned food, milk, sardines, mayonnaise, pasta, soap, couscous, toilet paper, vegetable oil, etc.) in her store, which is located in her home. Ayaba Rosine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Ayaba Rosine has not obtained any loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) so far. To further increase her business and satisfy the demands of her growing clientele, Ayaba Rosine is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 boxes of soap, 3 cans of vegetable oil, 3 boxes of sugar, and cans of milk

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.en:
Juan is 60 years old, married, and lives in Ita. Juan and his wife, Nymia, have two grown children who live in a neighborhood located near the center of town where Juan has a tailor shop. He manufactures clothes and bags for individuals and companies well known in the capital. 
Juan has worked at his tailor shop for over 20 years, during which time he has provided for his family. 
Juan will use this loan to buy fabric, thread and buttons, to meet the high demand there is for clothing for the holidays. 
This purchase will result in greater sales and therefore higher profits.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons

loans.name: Blanche

texts.fr: N. Blanche est née en 1975 à Abomey-Calavi, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUESSOU Albert, un électricien moto, Blanche est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Blanche vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari depuis neuf ans, au quartier Cococodji, à proximité de Cotonou. Blanche a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Seul le conjoint de Blanche supporte les charges de la famille. Il y a sept ans de cela que Blanche mène comme activité, la vente de tissus, sacs et de chaussures par le système de distribution. Blanche s’approvisionne à Lomé, capitale du Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Blanche a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. En vue d’augmenter davantage la taille de son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle à l’approche des fêtes, Blanche sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé. Blanche ambitionne ouvrir sa propre boutique pour y vendre ses articles.
texts.en:
Blanche N. was born in 1975 in Abomey-Calavi, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Albert Houessou, a motorcycle electrician, Blanche has two children, both in school. Blanche has lived together with her husband and children for nine years in the Cococodji area, close to Cotonou. Blanche ended her education in secondary school. Only Blanche's husband provides for the family. For seven years, Blanche has run a business selling fabric, bags, and shoes through the distribution system. Blanche gets her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin. Blanche has already benefited from one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. To further increase the size of her business and better satisfy her clientele with the upcoming holiday season, Blanche is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ. Blanche aspires to open her own shop in which to sell her items.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one dozen pairs of shoes, 3 dozen bags, and 13 bolts of fabric

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 41 years old. She is a single mother with two children, 19 and 11 years old, who both are currently studying and planning to go to college. Lucila sells food (patties, cutlets, croquettes, etc.) in a small place that, for the past 20 years, has operated in the municipal market in the city of Ita. She gets up very early at 4 in the morning to start cooking and preparing food for sale. Lucila’s business has a very good flow of clients, especially on weekends.

Thanks to the income that her business generates, her children have been able to get a good education. Lucila never had the opportunity to finish school, as she came from a very poor family and had 5 brothers. Lucila loves her work, as she is doing well and it brings her very good profits. She loves cooking and working in the kitchen. She plans to use the loan to buy a greater variety of beverages and to conduct necessary repairs to her store.

loans.use: To buy beverages and conduct repairs for her store

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Elias G. se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros, tiene un taxi de su propiedad.
su taxi esta funcionando bien, pero necesita hacerle cambio de llantas y de algunos repuestos y mantenimiento al motor, cambio de aceite, filtros, empaques y otros.
el desea mejorar su unidad para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Juan Elias tiene clientes fijos que lleva todos los dias en las mañanas para los trabajos y en las tardes para sus casas, durante el dia anda buscando clientes por toda la ciudad de danli y ahi hace muchas carreras.
Juan Elias se siente muy feliz ya que su carro le esta generando dinero y tiene pensado comprar mas carros para ponerlos de taxi.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos y desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Elias G. owns a taxi (passenger service) business. His cab is working well, but needs to change its tires and some parts in order to do tune up his engine (oil change, filters, gaskets, etc.) Making these repairs will help him provide better service to his customers. Juan Elias has regular customers who use his services daily in the mornings for work transportation and in the afternoons to return home. And, during the hours in between, he drives all over the city of Danli and takes in many other customers. Juan Elias is very happy because his car is generating income, and he hopes to purchase additional cars to use in his taxi service. This is his only source of income and he wishes to improve the quality of his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de repuestos de automovil (to purchase automobile parts)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
el sr. Mario V. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Flores, se dedica al comercio, su negocio es compra y venta de muebles de hierro para salas, electrodomesticos como ser hornos electricos, tostadoras, planchas, batidoras, licuadoras etc.
ahorita Mario no tiene capital para invertir en comprar su producto ya que casi todo lo tiene vendido a varios clientes, pero como el trabaja al credito no logra reunir todo el dinero de un solo para comprar mas mercaderia por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas electrodomesticos y asi tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias en esta epoca de navidad que es cuando mas se vende.
se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio lo esta sacando adelante a el y a su familia que es lo mas importante que el tiene.
texts.en:
Mario V., 37, lives in the Las Flores neighborhood. He is a merchant who sells metal furniture and home appliances like electric ovens, toasters, irons, mixers, blenders, etc. Right now, Mario lacks funds to invest in inventory since just about everything is already sold to various customers. But, because he extends his items on credit, he is unable to gather enough funds all at once to buy more merchandise. For this reason, he is requesting financing to buy home appliances so that he can have better sales and higher profits, especially now during the Christmas selling season when sales are at their best. He is very happy because his business is allowing his family, who is the most important thing he owns, to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electric ovens, toasters, blenders, hair dryers, mixers and metal room dividers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wendy Aracely

texts.es:
la sra. WENDY ARACELY M. se dedica al comercio y cuenta con un pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "GABY" , actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 2 años, es Madre de 2 hijos que tienen 4 y 1 año de edad. Con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre con algunos gastos del hogar contribuyendole a su esposo .
Wendy comento que la necesidad del credito es para surtir mas y asi mejorar las ventas en su negocio y mejorar las ganancias a pesar de que se ha visto una baja en los meses anteriores por la situacion de nuestro pais pero todo a ido mejorando poco a poco.
gracias a las cosechas de granos y café las familias han podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
WENDY ARACELY M. is a merchant and has had a small general store, called Pulpería "GABY," for the past two years. She has two children who are 4 and 1 year old. With income generated from her store she is able to help her husband meet some of the household expenses. Wendy stated that the funding is needed to restock her store so that her sales and profits will increase despite the losses suffered the last few months due to the situation the country is undergoing. Still, things are beginning to improve little by little. Thanks to coffee and grain harvests, families have been able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, lard, meats, dairy products, pastas, sauces, bread, soft-drinks, toilet paper, matches, churros (fried dough pastries dusted with sugar and cinnamon), condiments.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es:
el sr. PANFILO M. H. tiene 59 años de edad, cuenta con una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "Don Pancho",  actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 4 años, es padre de 4 hijos. con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre los gastos Familiares.
el necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio ya que los carros distribuidores solo pasan una vez a la semana y a veces no pasan generandole perdidas por tener que ir a comprar a la ciudad de Danli y esto le ocasiona gastos de pasajes y tiempo para realizar las compras , el solicita el credito para comprar mercaderia en cantidades suficientes para suplir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Y ahora con la subida de los precios de café el piensa que le ira mucho mejor ya que las personas compran mas en su pulperia y asi que sus clientes no se le vayan para otra tienda.
texts.en:
PANFILO M. H., 59, has had a small general store called Pulpería "Don Pancho" for the past 4 years. He is the father of 4 children. With income generated from his store he is able to meet household needs. He needs financing to stock his store because delivery trucks only come by once a week and sometimes then don't come by at all which causes him losses because he has to go into the city of Danli to buy supplies and this means transportation costs and time lost shopping. He is requesting financing to buy merchandise in quantities large enough to meet his customers' demand. He hopes that now, with the increase in the price of coffee, that his customers will do much better and buy more in his store so that they don't go shop at some other store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, tortillas, cornmeal, powdered milk and soft-drinks, dairy products, churros (fried dough pastries dusted with sugar and cinnamon), soft-drinks, soaps, toilet paper, pastas, sauces, candles, matches, pills, lard, oil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Transito

texts.es:
La Sra. María F. es socia del banco comunal Las Pauteñitas, vive en la comunidad de Jadan, tiene 52 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión matrimonial ha procreado 4 hijos de 30, 27, 24, 20 años de edad, todos sus hijos se encuentran solteros trabajan todos pero no ayudan en casa solo trabajan para sus gastos personales, su esposo trabaja como chofer, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.
María se dedica a la venta de pollo pelado, lleva 8 años en este negocio, compra pollos, los pela y vende en el mercado de San José de Paute, le va bien porque cuenta con su clientela, se lleva con todas sus compañeras del bankito, se encuentra en el segundo ciclo y nos comenta que le agrada el banco comunal por la facilidad de los pagos y por los beneficios que recibe, con el nuevo préstamo que FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregara va a invertir en comprar mas pollos vivos para solventar la demanda de  sus clientes, su meta es de seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María F. is a member of the Las Pauteñitas Communal Bank. She lives in the Jadan community. She is 52, married, and has four children. They are 30, 27, 24, and 20. All of her children are single and work. They do not help at home; they only work for their personal expenses. Her husband works as a driver. Through the efforts of his work they have been able to build their own house. María sells plucked chickens. She has been in this business for eight years. She buys the chicken, plucks them, and sells them in the San José de Paute market. It is going well for her because she has regular customers. She gets along with all of her colleagues in the bank. She is in her second cycle. She says that she is grateful to the communal bank for the simplicity of the payments and for the benefits that she receives. With the new loan from Fundación Espoir she will buy more live chickens to meet her customers’ demand. Her goal is to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy live chickens

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María Fernández es socia del banco comunal Las Pauteñitas, vive en la comunidad de Pirincay en el cantón de Paute, tiene 43 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada hace 3 años tomando la decisión porque su esposo fue muy malo, en su unión ha procreado 3 hijos de 24, 23, 17 años de edad, su primer hijo emigro para darles una mejor calidad de vida quien le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija se encuentra casada y vive en su casa ayudándole económicamente y su último hijo estudia en el colegio Febres Cordero en la ciudad de Cuenca, fruto de su esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa.

María trabaja en un tienda de abarrotes que es de su propiedad, lleva 20 años en el negocio y nos comenta que le va bien, tiene un local en jardines de Paute, se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, se encuentra en el segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación y le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la fundación Espoir le otorgará, va a invertir en el surtido de su negocio, su sueño es de ver a su hijo ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
María Fernández is a member of Las Pauteñitas communal bank and lives in the Pirincay community in the Paute county. She is 43 years old and was divorced 3 years ago, making the decision because her husband was very bad. In her marriage she had 3 children, who are now 24, 23, and 17 years old. Her first son emigrated to provide the family a better quality of life and help financially. Her daughter is married and lives in her house also supporting the family financially. Her youngest son studies at the Febre Cordero school in the city of Cuenca, and as a result of his efforts he was able to build his house. María works in a grocery store which she owns. She has had the business for 20 years and says that it is going well. Her business is located in Jardines de Paute. She gets along well with all her fellow communal bank members. She is currently in the second loan cycle working with loans from Kiva partner Fundación, which have benefited her business. With the new loan that Kiva partner Fundación Espoir will provide, she is going to invest in stocking up her business. Her dream is to see her son become a good professional.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and oil supplies.

loans.name: Nelson Javier

texts.es:
el sr. NELSON JAVIER M. L. se dedica a la ganaderia y caficultura desde hace mas de 10 años, 
es padre de 2 hijos y con los ingresos que le genera este negocio cubre los gastos familiares.
esto le a permitido ir creciendo poco a poco, ahora se le presenta la oportunidad de comprar terneros a un buen precio y no quiere perder la oportunidad de comprarlos.
tambien el se dedica a la caficultura y dentro de unos 2 meses se aproxima la corta del cafe y desea  alcanzar excelentes precios al momento de la venta de su café para prepararse para el año que viene.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier Nelson M. L. has been focused on cattle ranching and coffee growing for over 10 years. He is the father of two children, and with the income that his business generates, it covers family expenses. This has allowed him to grow little by little, and now he has the opportunity to buy calves at a good price and does not want to lose that opportunity. Javier also grows coffee, and within two months, he can begin selling it and wants to achieve excellent prices when selling his coffee so that he can prepare for next year.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves for pasture

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. María J. es socia del banco comunal Las Pauteñitas, vive en el cantón Paute, tiene 45 años de edad, se encuentra casada siendo el fruto de su unión conyugal sus 4 hijos de 22, 18, 12, 10 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y ayuda un poco económicamente en casa, su segunda hija se graduó del colegio y por ahora se encuentra ayudando en el negocio, su tercer hijo estudia en colegio 26 de Octubre en el cantón Paute y su ultimo hijo estudia en la escuela Isidro Ayora, también tiene a cargo un sobrino de 8 años de edad, prácticamente es como su madre por que le crio desde que tenía 6 meses de edad, sus padres son separados y viven en el extranjero y no se acuerdan de su hijo, solo su madre le envía un poco de dinero para su alimentación, su esposo trabaja como chofer de una cooperativa de transporte, con el esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

María se dedica a la venta de frutas y pollo asado, con el puesto de frutas lleva 13 años y le va bien vende los días domingo, lunes, martes y miércoles, con su negocio de venta de pollos asados al carbón lleva 2 años y vende los días jueves, viernes y sábados, en Pirincay conocido como los Jardines de Paute, tiene un gran vinculo de amistad con todas las compañeras del banco comunal, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo trabajando con los prestamos del banco comunal y nos comenta que le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, le  entregara va a invertir en su negocio de pollos y frutas, su meta es de salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
María J. is a member of Las Pauteñitas communal bank and lives in Paute county. She is 45 years old, married, and from her marriage has 4 children, ages 22, 18, 12, and 10. Her first daughter works and helps a little bit economically in the house. Her second daughter graduated from school and is now helping with the business. Her third child, a son, studies in the school October 26 in Paute county. Her youngest son attends the Isidro Ayora school. She is also in charge of her 8-year-old nephew, and is practically her mother since she has raised him since he was 6 months old. His parents are separated and live abroad and do not remember their child. His mother only sends a small amount of money for food and her husband works as a driver of a transportation cooperative. With the strength of their marriage they have managed to build their own house. María works selling fruit and grilled chicked. She has had her fruit stand for 13 years, which is going well, and she sells fruit on Sundays, Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays. She has had her grilled chicken business for 2 years, and she sells chicken on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays. In Pirincay, known as the Jardines de Paute, she has a strong bond of friendship with the members of the communal bank. She is on her fourth loan cycle working with the loans of the communal bank, and mentions that her business has benefited from the loans. With the new loan from Kiva partner Fundación ESPOIR, she is going to invest in her chicken and fruit business. Her goal is to continue moving forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Apples, oranges, other fruit, and chicken which will be grilled and sold.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
el sr. HENRY S. tiene 2 1/2 años de haber iniciado con su pulperia, misma que opera bajo el nombre de "Púlpería ANY" ademas de su negocio tambien tiene un molino de Maíz, sus negocios los tiene ubicados en su casa de habitación.
Don Henry, se levanta a las 4:00 A.M a moler el maíz para las personas que se dedican a la venta de tortillas y otras mujeres que se levantan para moler maiz para su consumo ya que tienen que hacer las comidas temprano a sus esposos que salen a trabajar en las fincas y montañas en comunidades de Oculi.
sus clientes lo prefieren por la atención que les brinda y por los precios que él ofrece, hasta los otros dueños de pulperías dicen que don Henry es el que vende mas barato de la comunidad, el
lo hace así para tener mayor rotación de inventario y ganarse cada dia mas a su clientela.
El Sr. S., es casado y padre de 4 hijos, los cuales dependen a un 100% del matrimonio y su esposa se dedica a la Sastreria (modista) misma que recibe sus ingresos extra y en lo poco que ella puede colabora a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar y cubre sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry S. has been working for 2.5 years with his grocery store, which operates under the name "Pulperías ANY". In addition to his business, he also has a corn mill. Both businesses are located in his home. Mr. Henry wakes up at 4:00 am to grind corn for people engaged in the sale of tortillas, and other women wake up early to grind corn for consumption as they have to make meals for their husbands who go to work early on farms and mountains in the communities of Oculi. His customers prefer him for the attention that he gives them and the prices he offers. To the other owners of similar grocery stores, they say that Mr. Henry is selling too cheap to the community, which means he has higher inventory turnover and earns more from his customers every day. Mr. Sullivan is married and has 4 children, who are 100% dependent on Henry and his wife, who focuses on tailoring (as a dressmaker) for which the family receives extra income. What little she can save goes to cover certain household and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, butter, soap, salt, coffee, seasonings, corn and wheat flour, instant soups, juices, churros, margarine and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzmila Dolores

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, está formada en la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad con una belleza arquitectónica, teniendo un centro colonial, Cuenca está delimitado por sistemas montañosos, El nudo del Cajas es punto de origen de un sistema hídrico formado por 4 ríos principales: Tomebamba, Yanuncay, Tarqui y Machángara que atraviesan el valle de oeste a este, su gente es cálida, amable y siempre luchan para tener una vida más digna como muestras socias.

La Sra. Dolores C. es social del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por el sector de la Virgen del Milagro en el Tejar, en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene62 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha procreado 6 hijos de 34, 32, 30, 28, 26, 24 años de edad, sus 3 primeros hijos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente de su casa, sus 3 últimos hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su hijo de 26 años se encuentra estudiando en el colegio y su hijo de 24 años estudia en la Universidad, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, con el esfuerzo conyugal ha logrado construir su casita.

Dolores se dedica a la crianza de pollos, nos comenta que empezó en este negocio desde que realizo su primer crédito más o menos unos 9 años, que el alimento se encuentra caro y sus pollos se han enfermado, sus pollos los vende en la comunidad por que cuenta con su clientela, se lleva con todas las compañeras de la banca comunal, se encuentra 9 años trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación le ha entregado y le han ayudado para iniciar con su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos, su alimento y vitaminas, su sueño es que le vaya muy bien en su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank Futuro Para un Bienestar is based in the city of Cuenca, a city with architectural beauty and a colonial center. Cuenca is bordered by a series of mountains. The crux of Cajas National Park is the point of origin for the region's water system consisting of 4 major rivers: Tomebamba, Yanuncay, Machángara and Tarqui, which pass through the valley from west to east. Its people are warm, friendly and always strive for a more dignified life such as our community bank members. Ms. Dolores C. is a member of the community bank Futuro Para un Bienestar. She lives near the sector of Virgen del Milagro in Tejar in the city of Cuenca. She is 62 years old, married and has 6 children of ages 34, 32, 30, 28, 26 and 24. Her first three children are married and live independently in their own homes. Her youngest three children work and help her financially. Her child of 26 years of age is studying at school, and her son of 24 years is in university also. Her husband works in agriculture. With marital effort, they have built their own home together. Dolores raises chickens, and she says her business began in this business with her first loan nearly 9 years ago because food was becoming more expensive and her chickens were sick. She sells her chickens in her community where she has most of her customers. She gets along with all of the partners in her community bank. She has been working with the foundation for nearly 9 years now, which has given her the opportunity to start her own business. With this new loan from Fundación Espoir, she is going to invest in buying more chickens, food and vitamins. Her dream is that everything goes well with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, food and vitamins for raising

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José, tiene  31 años de edad, es casado. Francisco tiene un negocio de brindar el servicio de taxi. dio inicio a su negocio hace  13 años con muy poca clientela  por lo que poco a poco fue aumentando debido que cada pasajero le daba su número telefónico y así el servicio es mucho más eficiente, ya que tenia la necesidad de buscar un medio para sustentar a su familia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para su automóvil. Su sueño con respecto al negocio es mejorar cada día como persona y además tener otro taxi.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco José is 31 years old and is married. Francisco has a business providing taxi service. He started this business 13 years ago, as he had the need to look for a means through which he could support his family. He began with a very small clientele, and little by little it has increased because each passenger gave him their telephone number, and so his business became much more efficient. This loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for his automobile. His dream with respect to the business is to improve every day as a person, and also to have another taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
La señora Zaida es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 41 años y es una orgullosa madre de dos hijos. Zaida se dedica a la venta de abarrotes,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la Municipalidad de Pucallpa. Zaida forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos”, desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó para comprar artículos de pasamanería. 
Con este crédito de 1200 soles, lo utilizará para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos e implementar su bodega. La meta de la señora Zaida es tener una bodega bien implementada en un ambiente amplio para una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zaida is a dynamic partner and collaborator. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and is a proud mother of two children. Zaida dedicates herself to the sale of groceries. She counts on the support of her husband who works in the Municipality of Pucallpa. Zaida has been part of the Municipal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos” for eight years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles ($100), which she used to buy trim items for drapes and upholstery. With this loan of 1200 soles ($425), she will buy products like rice, sugar, and pasta and set up her store. Zaida’s goal is to have a well-run store in a spacious environment for better service for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery items like rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Olga Jacoba

texts.es:
la sra. OLGA JACOBA L. tiene mas de 14 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa y calzado, es notable el crecimiento y la administración que le a dado a su negocio, ya que nos comento que  a traves de las ganancias que su negocio le a dado durante varios años los ha ido invirtiendo en la compra de mas mercaderia y asi logra instalar su propia tienda, la que se denomina TIENDITA LA BARATA, y esto debido al buen precio que maneja a su negocio.
En principio doña Olga vendia de forma ambulante y a medida crecia su negocio se vio en la necesidad 
de instalarse en un lugar fijo y asi darle una fina atencion a su apreciable clientela, Olga esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada de mayor ventas del año y asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
OLGA JACOBA L. has sold clothing and shoes for more than 14 years. Especially noteworthy is the management and growth of her business, as she told us that the earnings generated by her business over a number of years were reinvested in the purchase of more merchandise, and due to the good prices that she manages to offer she was able to establish her own store, which is called "Tiendita La Barata." At first Doña Olga sold in the streets and as her business grew she saw the necessity of having a fixed site, so that she could give good service to her substantial clientele. Olga is requesting this loan to better supply her business, since we are approaching the peak season for sales and she wants to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, T-shirts, dresses, and undergarments for women and men

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
