El un hombre muy responsable ya que le preocupa que su hijo obtenga los estudios necesarios. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo de ropa, calzado, perfumes y colonias.
texts.en:
Félix Antonio B. M. is 38 years old and has a business selling various products. He's had this business for more than four years, and would like to find an alternative means of income in order to support his family, and give them a place to live. If his business is successful, his dream is to build a house with all the amenities. Felix is very responsible and ensures his son is obtaining a good education. The loan he is requesting will cover working capital and will buy clothes, shoes, perfumes and colognes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou B. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l'avoir contracté à 15 fois et remboursé sans difficulté. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle achète les sujets, les engraisse et les revend. Elle développe parallèlement un petit commerce d'arachide. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Astou B. is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH for 7½ years. She has a good loan record, having taken out a loan 15 times and repaid them without a problem. Her work involves fattening sheep. She buys them, feeds them, and then sells them. At the same time, she's developing a small peanuts business. She takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her investment capital

loans.name: Ángel Eliud

texts.es:
El señor Ángel Eliud R. ha tenido ya dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente y le han servido para construir en su vivienda. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder poner el vitropiso en el cuarto que construyo con los anteriores créditos. Ya que en este momento el no cuanta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de colocar el vitropiso. 
Don Ángel es empleado de un establecimiento que se dedican a comprar y vender partes de autos usados, en el departamento encargado, este es el ingreso de su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Claudia Ivonne Barcenas, esposa del señor Ángel Eliud  ya que el día de la visita el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ángel Eliud R. has already taken out two loans with Kiva partner FVP. Both loans were used to build his house, and he has paid them timely. Today he is requesting a loan to tile the floor of the room he built with the previous loans because currently he does not have the money to buy the materials and pay the person who will install the tiles. Ángel is employed as a manager in a used auto-parts business, and his income goes to support his family; a portion of it will now also go to pay back the loan. The person in the picture is Mrs. Claudia Ivonne Barcenas, Mr. Ángel Eliud's wife; the day we visited his home, he was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and installing tiles for a room

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Mrs. Teodora C. is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and is blessed with three school-aged children. Teodora owns and operates a hog-raising business, earning 2,500 PHP monthly net income. In 2004, Teodora joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 8th loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP which will be used for cocoland (coconut tree plantation) redemption. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem a parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 59 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a la famila de uno de sus siete hijos en el caserío Los Bances, distrito de Pacora, ubicado a una hora y treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde que formó su hogar, ella nos cuenta que empezó su negocio debido a que el trabajo de su esposo, la agricultura, no le brindaba los recursos permanentes que necesitaba para sostener a su familia. 

Ella cría ovejas y aves de corral (patos, pollos, pavos) y las vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona cada tres meses. Los ingresos que percibe ayudan a solventar los gastos diarios de su familia. Su cría de patos ha aumentado considerablemente pero Rosa no tiene los recursos suficientes para alimentarlos por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Su sueño es poder arreglar su casa, ya que la temporada de lluvias se acerca y su casa siempre sufre considerables daños. Ella es una mujer optimista, trabajadora y muy empeñosa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 59-year-old homemaker who lives with her husband and the family of one of her seven children in the hamlet of Los Bances, in the Pacora district, located 90 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She raises and sells animals; she tells us that she started her business because her husband's job, in agriculture, did not give her enough to maintain the ongoing basic family needs. Rosa raises sheep and fowl (ducks, chickens, turkeys) and she sells them to the merchants who visit the area every three months. The money she makes helps with her family's daily expenses. The raising of ducks has increased considerably, but Rosa does not have enough resources to feed the birds well. Thus, she has requested her first loan of PEN 1000 to Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa with which she will buy balanced feed. Rosa dreams to be able to fix her home since the rainy season is approaching and her house always suffers considerable damage from the bad weather. She's optimistic, hard-working, and very entrepreneurial.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying balanced feed for fowl

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building a wall around his house

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La señora Olga Z. es un señora que demostró ser una buena madre que ante la situación económica saco a su hijo adelante que ahora es un padre de familia. Olga desde hace 18 años puso un negocio de comida hasta hacer un restaurante llamado “El tío Toto”, en el negocio ella vende variedad de platillos de la región.  Para poder seguir con su negocio ella esta requiriendo una estufa industrial por que la que tiene es pequeña y no abastece las ordenes del cliente, para no quedar mal recurre a nosotros para pedir apoyo económico para comprar su estufa con el fin de que el cliente se vaya satisfecho.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Z. is a great mother who, beating all economic odds, provided and cared for her son, now a father and husband. Eighteen years ago, Olga started her food selling business, eventually setting up a restaurant, "El Tio Toto," at which she offers a variety of regional dishes. To continue her business, she needs an industrial stove; the one she currently has is small and cannot keep up with the customers' orders. She has asked Kiva partner FVP for financial assistance so that she can buy her stove and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying an industrial stove

loans.name: Francisca Esperanza

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo, la última de sus cinco hijos y un nieto en el caserío Los Bances, distrito de Pacora, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de frutas: en una huerta cercana a su casa tiene árboles de ciruelas, pacaes, mangos y tamarindos los cuales dan fruto entre los meses de diciembre a mayo. Durante esta temporada ella va a vender sus frutas todos los días a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su esposo es agricultor y con el dinero recaudado por ambos sacan adelante la economía de su familia.

La escasez de agua para irrigación de cultivos que existe en la zona ha hecho que la mayoría de agricultores caven pozos desde donde extraen el agua que necesitan para sus sembríos mediante motores. Francisca desea regar sus árboles frutales para mejorar su producción este año, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en los gastos que supone el regar su huerta con motor (alquiler de motor, gasolina, mano de obra, entre otros).

Su sueño es seguir trabajando en el cultivo de frutas para hacer refuerzos en la estructura de su casa debido a las fuertes lluvias que suelen manifestarse en los meses de verano. Ella es una madre de familia amable, alegre y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Francisca is 42 years old, is married, and lives with her husband, the last of her five children, and a grandchild in the hamlet of Los Bances, in the Pacora district, located 90 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Francisca grows and sells fruit. In an orchard close to her house, she has plum, "pacae" (a Peruvian fruit), mango, and tamarind trees, which give fruit from December to May. During this time, she goes to Chiclayo every day to sell her fruit. Her husband works in agriculture, and the money they both earn covers the family expenses. Water scarcity makes irrigation of the orchards difficult; most farmers in the area have excavated wells from which they get the water they need using electric pumps. Francisca would like to water her fruit trees in order to increase production this year so, for the first time, she is requesting a PEN 1,000 loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. She will invest the loan proceeds in the costs she will incur watering her fruit trees (renting the pump, gas, labor, etc.). Francisca's dream is to keep working in her orchards so that she can make improvements to her house to endure the heavy summer rains. She is a happy, kind, and hardworking homemaker.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of watering orchard through rented pump

loans.name: María Natividad

texts.es:
La señora María Natividad H.  ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual paga puntual mente y le servio para mejorar su vivienda. Es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos adolescentes bajo su responsabilidad a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor.  
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto que será para sus niños. 
Doña María Natividad con algunos ahorros pudo comprar el material nada más le está haciendo falta pagar le a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejor, pero en esta momento no cuanta con el dinero ya que se gasto todo en el material. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito y planea pagarlo con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo, en la limpieza de una casa particular. Ya que los gastos de la casa familiares los cubrirá con la pensión alimenticia que recibe para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. María Natividad H. has already had a loan with FVP that was repaid on time and helped to improve her home. She is a single mother with two teenagers for whom she wishes to provide the best.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to build a room that will be used by her children. Doña María Natividad has savings set aside to purchase the materials, but she lacks the money to pay for labor. She plans to repay the loan using her earnings from her job as a housekeeper at a private home. Her family’s household expenses are covered by the alimony she receives for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the construction labor to build a room

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M., from the village of Canta-an, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 43 years old, married and the mother of three grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business whose income is derived from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina L. es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a tres hijos de diferentes edades y quienes dar lo mejor. 
Doña Alejandrina desea construir un cuarto de material para que sea mas duradero ya que será para su niños. 
Pero tiene un problema que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagarle a la persona que le realizara la mejora. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como trabajadora de una fabrica de electrónicos en le departamento de producción. Ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su hija la señorita Idalia Ixtapan L., que trabaja en una agencia aduanal en el departamento de sistemas.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandrina L. is a single mother who is responsible for three children of different ages. She wants to provide them with the best.

Doña Alejandrina wishes to build a room of durable materials since it will be used by her children. Her problem is that she does not have the necessary funds to pay someone to undertake this project. For this reason, she is requesting a loan and plans to repay it with the income she earns as a factory worker for an electronics company. The family expenses will be covered by her daughter, Srta. Idalia Ixtapan L., who works in the systems department of a customs agency.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor & materials to have a room built

loans.name: Ressel

texts.en:
Ressel C.. from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, is 31 years old, married and the mother of an infant. To make a living, Ressel owns and operates a snack-vending business whose main income is derived from preparing and selling banana cue for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ressel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Federico F. le está haciendo falta lo colocación de un portón al frente de la casa y colocar el vitropiso. 
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar las mejoras, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo. 
Don Federico es empleado de una linia de trasportes en el departamento de chofer de camión de carga, este es el ingreso que obtiene para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Diana Meliza Mendoza esposa del señor Federico ya que el se encontraba en su trabaja el día de la visita.
texts.en:
At the home of Sr. Federico F., two projects are pending completion – installation of a security gate in front of the house and laying down a ceramic tile floor. He does not have the money needed to complete these improvements, so he is requesting a loan.

Don Federico works as a cargo truck driver for a transportation line. The income from this job enables him to support his family. A portion of his earnings will be used to repay this loan.

The person in the photo is his wife, Sra. Diana Meliza Mendoza. Sr. Federico was at work on the day of our visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of a security gate & a ceramic tile floor

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon G. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has eight school-aged children. Corazon owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela C. is now 48 years old. She is married to Mariano, 48 year old, who is an electrician in their village. They are blessed with seven children, three of whom are already graduated from college and are now working at private companies, while the others are still studying.

Despite their economic situation, they aim to give their children a better future by providing the best education as much as possible. They have helped each other to earn a living and finance the education of their children.

Farming is the common source of their living; they plant rice and vegetables twice a year. Aside from this, Angela is engaged in rice retailing to earn additional income since harvesting takes a long time. She wants to sell more rice, but she has inadequate capital to do so.

Angela would like to borrow Php 6,000 from Kiva lenders to acquire more rice to sell in their village since it is one of the basic commodities. She hopes that she can improve her small business and continue to support the schooling of their children.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Berdina

texts.en:
Berdina C. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, in the Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Berdina is married and has 6 school-aged children. Berdina owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies to the local community. Berdina has been running this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Berdina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berdina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Berdina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Berdina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ritchelyn

texts.en: Ritchelyn T. is from Pagadian City. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ritchelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ritchelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Ritchelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia I. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan, in Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Amalia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Amalia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Amalia has been running her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Amalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon S. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Corazon is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian A. is from Pagadian City. She is 36 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lillian owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lillian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. Lillian is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen S. is married with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband and children. To make a living, she sells food (breakfast and lunch) and coffee next to a school in the city, earning an income of US $10 per day. Her husband helps her every day with the business because this is their primary source of income and helps cover all types of expenses for the family. The family is also assisted by three of her children who are employed in different businesses such as restaurants and a hotel, earning enough income to make a living. Sovat and her family members want to improve their standard of living. Therefore, Sovat is asking for a loan of US $1,200 to expand her business. With the remainder, she wants to purchase new tables and chairs for her small restaurant.

loans.use: Expanding her business and buying new chairs and tables for the restaurant

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina M. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 56 years old. Marina is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Marina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa L. is from the village of P-4 Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Narcisa is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Narcisa sells fish to the local community. Narcisa has running her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Narcisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Narcisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Arlyn and her family make most of their income from farming. She is 32 years old, married and has four children: Jefferson, 12 years old and an elementary school student; Jenilyn, nine years old; Mica, seven years old; and Allysa, four years old. They live happily in the village of Rizal Santiago City. Arlyn would like to improve and expand a small business selling cosmetics. She started this business as a way to increase her income from farming, which is not enough to support her family. She has applied for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy additional products to sell, and also to buy supplies for her rice farm.

loans.use: to expand a business selling cosmetics

loans.name: Resvic

texts.en:
Resvic J. is from the town of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Resvic owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.

In 2005, Resvic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Resvic from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy feed for her pregnant pig

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita B. is 34 years old and makes a living providing manicures and pedicures. She opened this business as a way to supplement the income earned by her husband Lurico, who makes a living driving a van. They are blessed with four children: Janary, 13 years old and a freshman high-school student; Jenica, 12 years old, who is in the sixth grade; Jennifer, 10 years old and in grade three; and Jen-Larica, who is two years old. Merlita's small business allows her to pay day-to-day expenses, especially tuition fees and her oldest son's allowance. Merlita is known for being a friendly and good neighbor--one of the reasons why she has lots of customers. She also cuts hair and does various hair treatments. 

Merlita would like to expand her business but is hampered by a lack of capital. She is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to expand her small business. Her long-term goal is to open her own shop so that she will no longer need to travel around town seeking customers.

loans.use: to expand a small manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin B. is a 31-year-old single man, currently living at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. In 2009, Franklin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

He is requesting a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP as additional capital for his new business which is a sari-sari (variety) store. He is going to purchase items to make his new little store full of stock. This amount will be his 2nd loan from PMPC.

loans.use: purchase stock for his new sari-sari store

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Joelita E. is married, 42 years old, and has 9 school-aged children. A resident of Banisilon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, she grows corn, bananas and root crops and sells them at the market and even to her neighbors.

In 2005, Joelita joined Paglaum MPC because of their programs and services, and she is now applying for her 9th loan amounting to 3,000 PHP as additional capital to purchase fertilizer for corn, banana and root crop production. This purpose is to make her plants grow faster, healthy, and have a good harvest.

She wishes for her children to finish their studies and to be able to renovate their house for comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. is 56 years old and lives in Barangay Estefania Amulung, Cagayan. She is a widow who has been blessed with five children, all of whom have graduated from college and, as time and circumstances permit, help her run her small business making pancit (or noodles).  All of her children are married, and three work abroad as domestic helpers.

Rosita is very proud to have responsible and hardworking children who have finished their studies and become successful, even though a poor economy has restricted their job opportunities. She is also proud of the many sacrifices she has made for her children.

Rosita has been in her line of work for 20 years. She is applying for a loan for PHP 30,000 to buy supplies such as flour and other ingredients, as well as kitchen utensils. Securing the loan will be a great help in meeting her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a small noodle-making business

loans.name: Anelith

texts.es:
La señora Anelith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos”, Distrito de Zapatero, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar, le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas preparadas, ubicada en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su restaurant “A.” y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas y con  la amabilidad que le caracterizado siempre.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Anelith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Anelith belongs to the Manuela Ramos community bank in Zapatero district, Lamas province, in San Martín department. She is 36 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom she still supports. In order to contribute to family income, Anelith had the idea of opening a small business selling meals. She runs the business from her home where she has slowly gained experience in this type of work. She has become well known and much liked by her clients. She still runs this business, taking care of her customers who come to the restaurant “A.” on a daily basis. They are regular visitors because of the personal attention she provides, the tasty seasoning she puts in her dishes, and the friendly atmosphere which always surrounds her. With this S/.2,500 loan Anelith will buy bags of sugar, different types of vegetables, and cases of eggs and chickens. She also plans to buy kitchen utensils to replace those she currently owns. In this way she will provide her customers with better service and care. She feels very confident and wishes to get ahead in life. She is grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing her with peace of mind and the opportunity to achieve her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meal ingredients

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Marilú, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos”, Distrito D. Zapatero, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre D. 03 hijos; 02 que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando.

Marilú, lleva 08 años dedicándose a la venta D. Abarrotes, ya que ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar y por la falta D. trabajo, con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00, decidió implementar su pequeño negocio, obteniendo muy buenos resultados, desD. un inicio por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos, amigos y moradores D. la ciudad. En sus ratos libres, también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. las diferentes líneas como: Avon, Esika, CyZone y nos cuenta, que también le va muy bien, en este tipo D. actividad.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra, D. productos D. belleza, así complementar mas su negocio.

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marilú belongs to the Manuela Ramos Community Bank in the District of Zapatero, Lamas Province, San Martín Department. She is married, 37 years old and the mother of 3 children, two of whom still depend on her and are students.

Marilú has been selling groceries for 8 years, due to the necessity of increasing family income and the lack of work. With her first loan of 300 new sols she decided to start her small business, obtaining very good results from the beginning, due to the quality of her products, her comfortable prices, and good customer service.

At present, she continues the same business, located in her own house. Her principal customers are her neighbors, friends, and residents of the city. Also, in her free time, she sells cosmetics of different lines, such as Avon, Esika, or CyZone, and she tells us that this business is also doing very well.

With this loan of 800 new sols she will buy more products to add to her business; including rice, sugar in kilos, crates of eggs, items for personal hygiene and home cleaning, drinks in packets, sweets and other products to satisfy her customers. Part of the money will be invested in purchasing beauty products, thus complementing her business.

Today she feels very happy about the work and service she offers and she thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping people like her who wish to work and get ahead. And she hopes that they will continue for a long time and aid many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES IN ORDER TO AUGMENT HER PRODUCTS FOR SALE

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Mrs. Magdalena T. is married, 67 years old, and has 5 adult children. Her husband is a farmer and they are currently living at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Magdalena is requesting a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP as additional capital for her sari-sari store. This amount is her second loan since she first joined PMPC. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs and the stock of her store is now decreasing so she is planning to use the loan amount to purchase additional items for her little store.

Magdalena plans to expand her sari-sari store into a convenience store and wishes to see their family succeed in their chosen field of business.

loans.use: New purchased items for her existing business (sari-sari store)

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel B. is 53 years old and makes a living as a farmer and a local public official. He grows vegetables on a field next to his house, where he works hard to support his family's needs. He earns about PHP 400 daily, which he supplements with occasional jobs as a carpenter. Despite his hard work and enterprising nature, Joel’s income is not enough to support his family, so he has applied for a loan for PHP 7,000 to expand his farm.

Joel is happily married to Amparo B., who works as a clerk in the town's department of health. They are blessed with five children, four of whom are in college: Reychel, 23 and married; Jhon Rey, 21 and computer-technology student; Rey-Ann, 20 and a student of psychology; Reysa, 16, who is studying accounting; and Regielyn, 14 and in junior high school. The family lives in the village of Barangay Estefania Amulung,Cagayan.

Joel thanks Kiva lenders for their support and hopes he can secure the help he needs to expand his farm.

loans.use: to expand a small farm

loans.name: Nicida

texts.es:
La señora Nicida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos”, Distrito D. Zapatero, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 52 años, es madre D. 05 hijos, 01 que aun depenD. D. ella.

Nicida, lleva 04 años dedicándose a la confección D. ropas interiores y poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su propio taller y como tenia habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, logro implementarlo. 
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atienD.  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. 

 Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grandes y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Nicida belongs to the communal bank “Manuela Ramos”, in the Zapatero district of Lamas province in the San Martin region. She is married, 52 years old, and is the mother of 5 children, one of whom is still a dependent. Nicida has maD. undergarments for 4 years, and little by little she was generating her own income and saving her money, wanting to have her own workshop. With her skills in sewing she had no doubt that she could do it, and with the support of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization she was able to accomplish this. She tells us that it is going very well; she works on orders that her customers place in advance. She attends to them with characteristic friendliness and charisma. With this loan of 1,500 soles nuevos she will buy meters of fabric in different types and colors, tools such as scissors, thread on large spools in a variety of colors, needles for hand and machine sewing, pins and buttons. Today she feels like a very accomplished woman, with a desire to continue to reach for her goals and make her other dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for helping her start her business, and also for helping many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nenita R. is married, 63 years old, and has 6 adult children. Her husband is a farmer and they are currently living at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.

In 2002, Nenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store and to buy and sell rice. This will be her 8th loan through PMPC. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs so she is planning to use the loan amount to purchase additional items for her store. Nenita plans to expand her little store into a convenience store and wishes to see their family succeed in their chosen businesses.

loans.use: purchase stock for her sari-sari store and acquire rice to sell

loans.name: Đào Thị's Group

texts.en: Hà Đào Thị (10107070078) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by SEDA. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they all both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Xuân Trạch 07 (2). Hà is married and has four adult children. She operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month. In 2008, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,204,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Hà is now requesting a new loan of 4,142,000 VND which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 3rd from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrower in the group: Nguyễn Thị S. (10107070080) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Hà Đào Thị (10107070078) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ,, Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xuân Trạch 07 (2). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 4,000,000 VND. Vào 2008, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,204,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,142,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị S. (10107070080) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,142,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia M. is married, 37 years old, and has 6 school-aged children. Her husband is an employee at PEO (Provincial Engineering Office) and they are currently living at Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

In 2004, Lucrecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP as additional capital for selling cosmetic products. This will be her 13th loan through PMPC. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs so she is planning to use the loan amount to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.use: purchase cosmetic products to be sold in the neighborhoods

loans.name: Llani

texts.es:
La señora Llani, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos”, Distrito de Zapatero, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 29 años y 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas vivas, con un capital de S/. 300.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza. Llani, se levanta muy temprano, para alimentar a sus animales.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas, pavos, patos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Llani belongs to the communal bank “Manuela Ramos”, Zapatero District, Lamas Province, San Martín Department. She is single, 29 years old and has 2 children. Both of them still depend on her and they are in school

Due to the need to help her children move forward and thanks to her enterprising spirit and energy, she decided to start her own business, selling live chickens. She started with S/. 300.00, selling little by little and making herself better known among her clients. Llani wakes up very early in order to feed her animals.

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, she will buy more poultry, like chickens, turkeys and ducks. She will also invest part of the money in balanced food and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free from any diseases.

She feels very satisfied with her work, in spite of the fact that it’s hard work and she has to wake up early. She believes that the sacrifice is worth it to reach her dreams and goals she has for her life. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering support to Llani and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, food and vitamins

loans.name: Porcita

texts.en:
Porcita A. lives in the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old, married and has five grown children. She runs a store where she sells products people use daily, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Porcita has been in this business for more than five years and earns about 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Porcita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. Porcita has successfully repaid two previous loans from GDMPC. She used those loans to buy additional products to sell, and has applied for a new loan to continue to secure more items to sell to her customers. She will use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dalmirith

texts.es:
La señora Dalmirith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos”, Distrito de Zapatero, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años y 02 hijos, todos ya independientes.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas vivas, con un capital de S/. 500.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas, pavos, patos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Dalmirith, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dalmirith belongs to the “Manuela Ramos” communal bank, located in Zapatero district, Lamas province, and San Martín department. She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children, both now independent.

Because of the need to raise her children and also her energy and entrepreneurial spirit, she decided to start her own business selling live hens. She started the business with capital of 500 soles and, little by little, built her clientele.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy more poultry birds, such as hens, turkeys, and ducks. Part of the money will also be used to buy balanced food and vitamins to keep the animals healthy and free of disease.

Dalmirith is very satisfied with her work, in spite of the fact that she works hard and has to get up early. She believes that it is worth the sacrifice to achieve her dreams and goals. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos group for offering support to her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry birds, food, and vitamins

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.es:
La señora Cesaria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Susana Galdos”, Distrito Zapatero, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años y 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella encuentran, todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Cesaria, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Cesaria, 31, is a member of the "Susana Galdos" communal bank which is in the Zapatero district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and they have two children, both of whom still are dependent on her. Her character and wish to continue to progress motivated her to start her own grocery store in her home the profits from which will help her meet her household expenses. She has steadily gained more customers from the time she started until today. She now can count on her regular customers who come to shop daily because they find all the products which housewives need and because they receive personalized attention from her with her characteristic charisma. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, crackers, packages of pastas and salt, boxed milk and preserved fish in a variety of brands, flats of eggs and personal hygiene items to continue to give her customers the best attention. Cesaria very much wants to continue working and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn C. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Genalyn is married and has 2 small children. To make a living, Genalyn owns and operates a recycling business selling empty bottled and broken plastic in the local community. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Genalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Genalyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Julgencia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Julgencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Susana Galdos”, Distrito D. Zapatero, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 54 años y es madre D. 04 hijos, 01 que aun dependen D. ella.

Con el fin D. contribuir con los ingresos económicos D. su hogar, le nace la idea D. aperturar un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comidas preparadas, ubicada en su misma casa, donD. poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su restaurant y es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con su rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas y con  la amabilidad que le caracterizado siempre.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios D. cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Maria Julgencia, se siente muy segura y con ganas D. seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
María Julgencia, 54, is a member of the "Susana Galdos" communal bank, which is in the Zapatero district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is a widow and mother of four children, one of whom is still dependent on her. In order to contribute to meeting household expenses, she came up with the idea of starting a small business selling prepared meals from her home. Little by little she gained more experience and became very well-known and liked among her customers. Currently, she is still in this business taking care of her customers daily in her eatery. It is she, personally, who takes care of them with the delicious taste of her meals and with the kindness that has always characterized her. With this 2,500 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, assorted vegetables, eggs and chickens. She will also buy some cooking utensils to replace some of the ones she has now in order to offer improved service and attention to her customers. María Julgencia feels secure and with the desire to continue forward insuring a tranquil life for herself. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn B. is one of the youngest entrepreneurs in Maricaban, Pasay City. She is 19 years old and is not married.

Two years ago, Juvelyn joined the bandwagon of women entrepreneurs engaged in direct selling of cosmetics and apparel from prominent direct-selling companies (such as Avon, Sundance, Natasha, and Marikina Shoe Exchange), which is a proven additional source of income for women in the Philippines. She also sells biscuits and cookies from factory surpluses. She currently earns more than 5,000.00 pesos a month. Her earnings provide for her personal needs.

Juvelyn also happens to be one of the newest members of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in Pasay City, having joined early this year. She hopes to receive from the cooperative the same social benefits her neighbors have been telling her about. She is now on her third loan cycle. She applied for a 9,000.00 peso loan as additional capital for her business. She dreams of having her own house and lot, and also a nice place to do business.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of cosmetics and apparel

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita D. S. from Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila. She lives with her husband Loveros. Lolita understands that life is hard but she says she has to have a strong faith to be able to survive.

Lolita owns and manages a general store which has been around for five years. She makes close to 19,000 PHP a month. Her profits help her to get through life.

In 2006, Lolita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. The loans provided by the cooperative help her continue her business.

Lolita is now applying for a new loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for the continuous growth of her store. She will re-stock on grocery inventories. She hopes to see her store grow even bigger.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza R. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 47 years old. Liza is married and has 3 children. The eldest is an adult while the remaining 2 are school-aged. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a business venture in the aqua-culture sector, culturing oysters. The main source of income for the business comes from oyster culture known as "talaba". Liza has been engaged in her business for over 7 years with approximate average monthly earnings of 3,000 PHP.

In 2007, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for oyster culture activities. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Liza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to support the education of her children.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for aqua-culture of oysters

loans.name: Hoàng Thị's Group

texts.en:
H. Hoàng Thị (10107070049) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. H. is the group leader of a six-member group requesting a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Xuân Trạch 07 (6).

H. is married and has three grown children. To making a living, H. operates a family member's business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,578,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,322,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the fifth loan she has taken out from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1. PH.m Thị B. (10107070047) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 3,270,000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop.

2. Vũ Thị L. (10107070051) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services.

3. Nguyễn Thị Hạ (10107070048) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

4. Đào Thị T. (10107070050) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. Bùi Thị C. (10107070063) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Hoàng Thị (10107070049) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ H.n hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xuân Trạch 07 (6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND. Vào 2006, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.578.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.322.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. PH.m Thị B. (10107070047) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.270.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt.

2. Vũ Thị L. (10107070051) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.

3. Nguyễn Thị Hạ (10107070048) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

4. Đào Thị T. (10107070050) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. Bùi Thị C. (10107070063) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda A. is a 40- year old businesswoman from Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila. She is married to Rodelito, 47, a welder/pipe fitter. They have four kids of whom two are in high school and one in grade school.

Imelda has a sari-sari (general) store located just in front of her house. In front of the store, she also sells cooked foods. She has been enjoying her business for almost 20 years now and earns 21,000 PHP a month.

Imelda joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004.

She has applied for a new loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP. She will buy more items to sell at her store to include soft drinks and rice.

She wants to see her general store to be bigger in the future than what it is now so she could help employ some of her neighbors. She also dreams of opening a restaurant soon. She also wishes to see all her children finishing their studies.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell including softdrinks.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie B. who lives in the village of Brgy. Patic, Pulupandan Negros Occidental,is 50 years old, and married to Jersom who is a fisherman. The couple have 2 children who are 14 and 20 years old.

Julie works hard to help her husband improve their living situation and send their children to school so that they will have a brighter future.

Julie believes that the family should come first before anything else; that’s why she is doing everything to improve their life by providing proper nutrition and education to her children. When she got married she decided to help her husband by selling his catch within their village and even up to the nearby towns.

She was so good at selling fish that demand from her regular customers grew, prompting her to think of expanding both her husband's fishing venture as well as her own operations. So she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 so that she could purchase additional fishing gear for her husband and have access to more capital for her fish vending business.

Business did not always stay up - through the years, Julie and her husband encountered ups and downs in their business but she never lost hope and held on to her dreams for her family - the one motivating factor that made her go on in spite of the hurdles they encountered.

Now, her business is more stable and she earns a monthly average income of 12,000 PHP which is quite sufficient for her family's household expenses with some left over for savings.

Julie’s previous loan of 19,500 PHP was utilized as additional capital for her fish vending and fishing business. The loan was fully repaid on time and in full without delay. For her 13th loan cycle she is borrowing the same amount to buy additional fishing nets for the fishing venture and to have working capital for her fish vending business.
