In the picture, Julie and her husband Jersom pose with their fishing boat and some of the catch which she will sell.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling and fishing materials.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda D. S., 43, lives in a Habitat for Humanity village within the BASECO Compound, Port Area, Manila (an islet near the Manila harbors). She has two children. Her husband Jose, 56, is a heavy equipment operator.

Imelda has been in business for more than 20 years. She sells different fruits in a flea market near their village. She also has a small sari-sari (general) store at home.

The combined earnings from her fruits business and general store are now close to 35,000 PHP a month, although her sales are affected very much during rainy season.

She has already made a few improvements in their house from her business profits.

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. The loans provided by the cooperative were very helpful in the growth of her business.

Imelda is now applying for a new loan in the amount of 21,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her businesses.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store.

loans.name: Đào Thị

texts.en:
T. Đào Thị (10107070005) is a 51-year-old woman who lives in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội. She is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To making a living, T. operates a family member's manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.204.000 VND from SEDA. She used the previous loan to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. T. is now requesting a new loan of 4.142.000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About SEDA The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Đào Thị (10107070005) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, T. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm được chế tạo thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.

Về SEDA Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон Джураев проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена работает в колхозницей на поле. Абдурахмон более 10 лет работает по специальности "электриком". Помимо этого он более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon J. lives in the Tursunzoda region. He is 50 years old, married and has five children. His wife works in the fields at a collective farm. Abdurahmon has worked as an electrician for more than ten years. In addition, he has kept livestock for over six years. He raises cattle for sale.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Majnunbek

texts.ru: Кахоров Мачнунбек проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Мачнунбек более 15 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает скот. У него имеюся постоянные клиенты, мясники. Кредит просит для закупа скота  и для дальнейшей продажи.
texts.en:
K. Majnunbek lives in the Tursunzoda region. He is 42 years old, married, with three children. Majnunbek has kept livestock for over 15 years. He raises and sells cattle. He has several butchers as regular clients. He is interested in obtaining a loan for purchase of livestock and for expenses associated with their sale.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa D., 46. is married to Arsenio D. and blessed with six children. Three are already married and three are single. They reside together at the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is situated near the Baranggay Health Center.

Marissa is engaged in hog-raising for almost 20 years. Every time she disposes of one hog she earns a net income of 5000 PHP. She works hard to increase her income and to strengthen her business.

Marissa decided to request a loan of 11,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to purchase hog feed and some hogs to raise. She wants to expand her pig pens to earn more income for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and some hogs to raise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza L. is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 37 years old. Analiza is married and has 3 school-aged children.

To make a living, Analiza sells seafood products including fish and shrimp to the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Analiza joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza successfully repaid her first loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which she used to purchase additional fish to sell. Analiza is requesting her second loan, for 5,000 PHP, which she will invest in expanding her business.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Barangay Uno. She is 45 years old. Evelyn is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling viands, fruits, and other grocery products in the local community. Evelyn is just starting this business.

In 2006, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

To make a living, Jorenda owns and operates a business serving a variety of different meals and soft drinks to customers in the local community. Jorenda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Samitina

texts.en:
Samitina P. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks like sodas, water, etc. to sell.  Samitina is 30 years old and is married to a school bursar. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has four children, between the ages of 10 and 22. He sells clothes and shoes in Gikomba Market and has one employee. He has been in business for fifteen years and has successfully completed two previous loans with Faulu. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more inventory. 

In the future, John would like to expand his business and become a more prominent businessman. He describes himself as hardworking and says that he has learned how to keep records and provide customer care in Faulu, where he is his group's treasurer.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Lilieta

texts.en:
Lilieta D. is from the village of Dawo. She is 58 years old. Lilieta is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lilieta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Lilieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP average per month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lilieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Twesige Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
John N. is the leader of his lending group in Kayunga. He is 30 years old and married with 3 children aged 10, 4, and 2. He takes care of 3 dependants. All of John’s children are in school.

He has a video store in Jinja, Aldina Road that has been operating for 5 years. He has all kinds of movies in stock and rents them out to home users and video halls. He is able to make 80,000 UGX of income per week. He succeeds by ensuring that he always stocks recent movies and by making music CDs and DVDs for his customers.

In the future, John strives to expand his business by opening other branches and hopes to build a house and educate his children. He needs a loan to buy new equipment, like a computer, to provide better service. He is grateful that the loans boost his business.

loans.use: To buy a computer to provide better service

loans.name: Neminda

texts.en:
Neminda M. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 53 years old. Neminda is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Neminda owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ground beef and pork products known as "longganisa" in the local community. Neminda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Neminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Neminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Neminda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Neminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Z. Battulga is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a house in Uvs province, Mongolia. His oldest son and daughter are both university students and his youngest son and daughter attend local secondary schools.

Battulga manages a meat and animal fat oil trading business in his town with the help of his wife. He sells a variety of meats and fat oil which he makes from the internal organs of animals. Animal fat oil is a popular product among residents who live far from the market and can't make frequent trips into town. They use it to make everyday foods such as buns and to fry potatoes. Battulga started his business in 2005 after working as a driver for a power plant since 1990.

Since he started, his business has grown quickly and has become quite profitable. He recently used his earnings to remodel his house. He says, "My business has enabled me to greatly improve my family's quality of life. I am now saving to buy a car which will help me operate my business in the future." Battulga is requesting a 750,000 MNT (~530 USD) loan to purchase animal fat and organs for his business.

loans.use: To purchase animal fat and organs for his business.

loans.name: Hewad Group

texts.en:
The Hewad group has three members: Naseer Ahmad, Hewad, and Samiulllah. They all live in district 3 in the city of Jalalabad. Naser is the group leader. He is 23 years old, married, and lives with his father, mother, and two sisters. He has a shop where he sells fresh fruit. He is a hard-working man, and with the income from his shop, he supports his family. When he gets the loan, he plans to start selling retail food. He hopes to have a good income and bright future.

Samiullah is the second member of this group. He has a retail food business. This is the only business that supports his family of three members.

Hewad is the third member of this group. He sells vegetables and is responsible for paying for all the expenses of his family.

They all have requested a group loan of 30000 Afghani to expand their businesses. They would like to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa A. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works as a security guard at a local branch office of one of Mongolia's largest banks, her three oldest children currently attend university, and her youngest two are in secondary school.

Bayarmaa operates a small grocery shop near her home. She sells a variety of food products to customers in her neighborhood. Bayarmaa started her business in 2008 with capital of 500,000 MNT (~350 USD) after previously selling consumer goods. She has found success in her first year of operation, and her shop is well established in her community. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT (~700 USD).

Bayarmaa has gained much business experience over the years and is currently planning to expand her business. She hopes to soon expand the product variety at her shop and says, "I would like to sell all the products that my customers demand. I also plan to sell coal and firewood at my shop." She is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (~910 USD) loan to purchase rice, flour, and other grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase rice, flour, and other grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Miracle

texts.en: Miracle sells iced and smoked fish in her community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. The demands for her fish are high in her community and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a major fish distributor in Benin City. She is a friendly and a hard working woman. She is determined to excel in her business and family life. She is 42 years old and married with six children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more cartons of fish to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of fish

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is single and 55 years old. To make a living, she sells bamboo shoots in the market of Cauayan, Isabela.  It has been her main source of income for years now, and supports her needs. She lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela.

Rosalinda is hoping to obtain a loan of 6,000 PHP to use as additional capital to purchase more bamboo shoots for resale in the market. Her business is really a big help in supporting her daily needs. She hopes that it will continuously be maintained, not only to help herself, but also to help her other relatives that need her help. As a single woman, she also wants to have some savings for herself which could be used in case of emergency.  She hopes to earn more profits in order to attain what she wants.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more bamboo shoots

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma, 33, is married to Anthony V., who is an employee of hypermarket at Cauayan City. They are blessed with three children: Mary Jane, 11 years old and a grade six student, Christine, eight years old and a grade three student, and Bea, seven years old and a grade one student. The family resides in the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is located near the Elementary School and national highway.

Thelma has been in the business of hog raising for almost six years. When she disposes of one hog, her net income is 5,000 PHP. She's asking for a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP from lenders to strengthen her business in order to improve her family's quality of life and to obtain her desired profits. She hopes that lenders will grant her loan, because she then will be able to use her income for their daily needs as well as for the education of her children. She plans to buy stock of feed for her raised animals. Aside from that, she also wants to purchase some hogs.

loans.use: To buy feed, and more hogs

loans.name: Senyi Women's Group Of Lugazi

texts.en:
Bilego M. is 58 years old and the leader of his group in Lugazi.  He is married with three children who are all currently enrolled in school, and he cares for two of his deceased brother’s children.  

Bilego has been a carpenter for 15 years and has served a lot of clients.  He attributes his success as a carpenter to his high level of customer service and his hard work and determination. He hopes to use the loan amount of 1,500,000 USH to inject capital into his business and purchase more supplies. In the future he would like to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry supplies

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
Ayush B. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Khovd Province, Mongolia. Her son and daughter are both university students and her husband works as a security guard at a local school. B. operates a flour, rice and sugar trading business at a local market in her town. She started her business in 2002, with the capital of 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) and has managed it by herself for the last seven years. She has worked hard and today enjoys a stable business operation. Her earnings have enabled her to remodel her house and pay all of her children's school tuition, and today her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). 

B. is a very open-minded and hardworking businesswoman and she has many plans for the future. She hopes to continue to increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of life. She says, "In Mongolia the swine flu is spreading very quickly and the Mongolian government is going to limit domestic transportation throughout the country. For this reason, I hope to purchase a large amount of products from Bayan-Ulgii, the closest province, before the government's decision."  B. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase three tons of flour from Ulaanbaatar.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase three tons of flour from the closest province in anticipation of government restrictions on travel

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells garri (food item made from cassava) and firewood at retail prices to her customers. With this combined business, she sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on the table to feed her immediate family members. She has been in this business for four years. She is 32 years old and married with six children. She is a focused, hard worker. She is determined to excel in her business. She is requesting for a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more garri and firewood to sell. She says that this will help to boost her business. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase garri and firewood to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State. The demands for her used clothes is high because there are people in her community that cannot afford new clothes. 

This is the high season for Elizabeth's business, and she hopes to make more profits during and after this season. She is 35 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a printer. She is a focused, hard worker. She is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more used clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Bolinchuluun

texts.en:
J. Bolinchuluun is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Tuv Province in central Mongolia. Her oldest son is currently serving in the Mongolian military and her youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. Bolinchuluun operates a grocery trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She started her business in 1999, with capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD), and has built a stable business over the last 10 years. Today, she has much experience as a businesswoman and has a great reputation among her many customers and suppliers. Her earnings have enabled her to remodel her house and purchase a car for her son, and her working capital currently exceeds 2,800,000 tugrugs (~1,970 USD). Bolinchuluun hopes to continue to expand her business in the future. She hopes to soon rent an extra stall at the market to sell consumer goods in addition to grocery items. She says, "My ultimate goal is to one day own my own shop." Bolinchuluun is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1,050 USD) loan to rent an additional stall at the market and to purchase flour, noodles, rice and oil for her grocery trading business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To rent an additional stall at the market

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 38 years old. Marilou is married and has 8 children. The eldest is adult; six of them are school-aged, and the youngest is an infant. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services to local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase manicure and pedicure materials, and livestock feed and supplies for her pig-raising activity. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marilou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the daily needs of the family and education expenditures of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure materials, and livestock feeds and supplies

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: S. Colette est née en 1978 à Bantè, dans le Nord du Bénin. Mariée à DINDIN Bernard, un mécanicien, Colette est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Colette vit avec son conjoint et ses enfants depuis trois ans à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Seul Bernard supporte les charges de la famille. Colette exerce le métier de couture depuis quatre ans déjà. Colette vend également dans son atelier situé à Cocotomey, des tissus et des articles de mercerie. Colette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Colette a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit de ALIDé qui a été bien remboursé. En vue d'accroître son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Colette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
S. Colette was born in 1978 in Bantè, in northern Benin. Married to DINDIN Bernard, a mechanic, she is the mother of two children who are all in school. She has been living with her husband and children for three years in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Bernard is the only one covering family expenses. Colette has been working in the sewing trade for four years already. She also sells cloth and sewing supplies in her workshop located in Cocotomey. She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She has had an ALIDé loan before, which was repaid. With the aim of growing her business and satisfying her customers more, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 bolts of cloth, 8 boxes of sewing thread, 5 rolls of popliin

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ren M. lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Leng Ly, is a motorbike taxi driver. He is also a farmer who owns 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, he faces some problems, because his field is far from the irrigation system and the soil needs fertilizer.

Thus, Mrs. Ren M. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and a water pump. She plans to use the rest of money to buy two more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. She is 48 years old and the mother of four children; one is a laborer, and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: Buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, a water pump for the farm, and two more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Agvaandorj

texts.en:
Agvaandorj A. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and two infant children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. His oldest child, age three, is in kindergarten and his youngest is only one year old. His wife currently works as a salesperson and has a monthly salary of 120,000 tugrugs (~84 USD). A. operates a wooden product making business in his town. He started his business in 2007, with capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD). 

Before starting his business, A. previously helped his mother run her grocery shop and learned much about how to operate a business. A. is very hardworking and always looks for ways to grow his business. In addition to making wood products, he also purchases manufactured products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell. For the future, A. plans to have his own workshop to make his products. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~490 USD) loan to purchase wood and other materials used to make his products. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase wood and other materials used to make his products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 46 years old and married with seven children.  Her husband works for the government. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has a grocery store where she sells groceries and foodstuffs. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna Y. lives in the Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. She is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to cultivate the rice field.

Her husband, Mr. Saem Moeun, uses a horse with a cart to transport goods and passengers. This couple has three children; two attend the local school, and the youngest child is just 3 years old. Her husband is in the picture with Mrs. Y..

loans.use: Buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to cultivate the rice field

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en:
Robinah is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and devoted lady and married with five children, ages 20, 17, 15, 11 and 9 years, who are all in high school and primary schools. 

She is a business lady who makes ice for children and has supplied to schools in Seeta, Bweyogerere and Mukono for five years now. From her transactions, she makes 40,000/= as profits a week. She is a lady with very good conduct, yet very responsible in her community. Robinah hopes to expand her business to other schools in other towns so that she can have a bright future together with her children. 

She needs a loan to help boost her business by buying more food coloring and paying her marketing workers.

loans.use: To buy more food coloring and to pay her market staff

loans.name: Bulganchimeg

texts.en:
T. Bulganchimeg is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arkhangai Province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a driver, and her son and daughter both attend a local secondary school. Bulganchimeg operates a dairy products trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000, with capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD). Over the years she has built a successful business and has a great reputation among her many customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD). 

Bulganchimeg works hard to continue her success in the future and hopes to soon expand her business. She is requesting a 1,400,000 tugrug (~1000 USD) loan to purchase more dairy products to sell.



About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is hard working woman who is determined to excel in her business and family life. She hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more used clothes to sell. 

She is 43 years old and married with four children. She hopes to give her children a quality education. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Raïssa Mahulon

texts.fr: G. Raïssa Mahulon est née le 25 Août 1977 et réside depuis 32 ans à Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Raïssa Mahulon est mariée à ADJOVI Hypolite. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Raïssa Mahulon vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ayant arrêté les études au cours secondaire, Raïssa Mahulon a commencé depuis 10 ans la vente de tissus, de mèches et des produits de beauté à Bazounkpa au Bénin. Raïssa Mahulon fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Raïssa Mahulon n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé.  Afin d’augmenter la taille de sa clientèle et son fonds de roulement pour pouvoir mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Raïssa Mahulon sollicite un premier crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Raïssa Mahulon was born on August 25, 1977 and has been residing for 32 years in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ADJOVI Hypolite.  The couple has two children who are both in school.  Raïssa Mahulon comes to her husband's aid to meet family expenses.  Having dropped out in secondary school, she started selling cloth, hair extensions, and beauty products ten years ago in Bazounkpa, Benin. She acquires her merchandise from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  Raïssa Mahulon has never had an ALIDé loan.  To increase her customer base and her working capital, so as to do better in satisfying her more and more numerous customers, she's requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bolts of cloth and 10 dozen hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Biyinzika Women's Group Of Lugazi

texts.en:
Prossy B. is 32 years old and the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is married and cares for her two children and her elderly parents. Prossy is a farmer who sells her crops at the Kikawula Trading Center, the central market in town. 

She has been in the business for one year and has learned a tremendous amount from the experience. Customers would sometimes not pay for her produce on time, making it difficult for her to operate, but now she requires all payment up front. She would like to use the loan to inject more capital into her business to insure a steady supply of goods for her customers. With continued hard work and determination, she hopes to one day be able to educate all her children and build her family a modern home.

loans.use: Capital for her farming business

loans.name: Chhum's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chhum C. is the group leader of six members who all live in Choes village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Phum Thoeurn, raises pig and ducks. Her poultry business is going well, so she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Chhum C. is requesting a loan to buy more ducklings for breeding. He hopes to increase their income and improve the family living conditions. This couple does not have any children.

Mr. Chhum C., Mr. Mon Y., and Mr. Sopheak E. are not requesting a loan but their wives are, so they appear in the picture instead.

loans.use: Buy more ducklings for breeding

loans.name: Tsetsegsuren

texts.en:
D. Tsetsegsuren is 36 years old and lives with her husband and child in a house in Khovd Province, Mongolia. Her 11-year-old child currently attends a local secondary school. Tsetsegsuren operates a cake trading and vegetable selling business in her town with the help of her husband. Tsetsegsuren spends most of her time selling cakes and her husband is responsible for growing and selling their vegetables. After harvesting, Tsetsegsuren and her husband store their vegetables to be sold during the winter when supplies are short because it is more profitable. Tsetsegsuren and her husband started their businesses in 2007, and they have steadily made progress over the past two years. Their earnings have enabled them to buy land and build their house. 

They have many plans for the future and hope to one day open their own bakery and produce their own cakes. Now she says, "I want to buy more cakes to sell during the upcoming New Years holiday. I would like to start a small cafe in the future too." Tsetsegsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase cake materials for her business. 




About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase cake materials for her business

loans.name: Baldan

texts.en:
T. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and 18 year-old daughter in Arkhangai Province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife works as an accountant at Weather Forecasting Center, and his daughter attends a local secondary school, while T. operates a transportation business in town. He started his business in 2005, with working capital of 250,000 tugrugs (~170 USD). Since then, his working capital has grown to exceed 6,000,000 tugrugs (~4200 USD). To supplement his earnings, T. also buys cut timber from the countryside and transports and sells it to the residents of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2,100 USD) loan in order to keep growing his transportation business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To keep growing his transportation business

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to make more profits this season. She is 46 years old and married with 10 children. Her children are in primary and secondary schools and they are doing well. With this combined businesses, she is able to put food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Savet's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savet D. is the group leader of five members who all live in Trapeang Krasang village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Savet D. is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She also raises pigs and now wants to expand her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some more piglets to raise and pig feed.

Mrs. Savet D. is 33 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Phou Sophat, is a taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy some more piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hen T. is the leader of a group of four members who all live in Trapeang Krasang village in Takeo province. She is 38 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.  Mrs. Hen T. is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. N. El, is a construction worker. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to maintain the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Hen T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding as well as some fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for breeding and fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Tsogtoo

texts.en:
B. is 23 years old and lives with her husband in Kharkhorin, the ancient capital of Mongolia. She and her husband live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is a shoe maker who works in a rented shipping container at a local market. Badamkhand operates a fruit and vegetable retail business in another space at an outdoor local market. She started her business in 2008, but since the weather is becoming very cold, she has decided to start a souvenir selling business where she can work indoors. Badamkhand is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~630 USD) loan in order to purchase souvenir products and rent a stall at the indoor market so that she can begin her business. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase souvenir products and rent a stall at the indoor market

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: A. Emilienne est née le 30 Juin 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Emilienne est mariée à ATCHEOU Rodolph et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Emilienne vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint depuis une dizaine d’année à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Emilienne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Emilienne vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de la sauce aux légumes et du poisson, et du riz). Emilienne  s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Emilienne a déjà acquis 20 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce ; mais elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. Afin de développer son activité et de l’agrandir davantage, Emilienne sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Emilienne was born on June 30, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ATCHEOU Rodolph and is the mother of four children who are all in school.  For 12 years, Emilienne has been living with her children and husband in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou.  She comes to her husband's aid to meet family expenses.  Emilienne sells food (cornmeal mash served with a sauce made with vegetables and fish; and rice).  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She already has 20 years of experience in this business;  but she has never had an ALIDé loan.  To develop her business and to enlarge it still, she's requesting her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and rice

loans.name: Croeb's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Croeb S. is the leader of a group of six members who all live in Boeng Satong village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Keo Nao, is a construction worker. The couple have five children; two are laborers and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Shagdarsuren

texts.en:
B. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and four-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the city. His wife is a salesperson at Narantuul market, one of the largest and most popular markets in Mongolia. B. operates a grocery business out of a rented stall at another local market. He began his business in 2005, and with the earnings, he has managed to buy a family car and a plot of land where he will build a house in the future. 

He would like to own his own grocery store in the future so that he can ensure his family’s financial security. B. is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1700 USD) loan in order to purchase a wider array of grocery products in order to begin expanding his business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase a wider array of products in order to begin expanding his business

loans.name: Mohammad Amen Group

texts.en:
M. Amen group is made up of three members. M. Amen, the group leader, is 53 years old.  He is married and the father of six children – four sons and two daughters.  He has a retail food shop. He wants to buy different food for his shop in order to expand his business capacity. 

The second member of M. Amen group Is Ulfat.  He runs a cosmetic-selling business. Through its income he supports his family members. 

The third member is M. Qaseem, who is a tailor. He is requesting a loan to buy new equipment and clothes to expand his business and increase his income. 

The three members of M. Amen group have requested a group loan of 42,000 AFN.  They would like to express their thanks to all Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: to expand the businesses of the group members

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en: Madonna is a married woman with two young children. She has owned a mini market in her town since 2007. She works hard to earn an income to help her husband. With her loan of $1,200, she will invest in adding new decor to her market in order to attract new clients.

loans.use: To add new decor to her market

loans.name: Batbuyan

texts.en:
B. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a ger district on the outskirts of the city. Together with his wife, B. operates a home goods retail business. They began their business in 2003, and the success of their business has allowed them to build a house where they will be living in the future. B. hopes to build a shop of their own so that they can stop renting operating space. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to build a garage by their house and purchase a large amount of home goods to sell in their business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To build a garage and purchase home goods to sell

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is 49 years old and lives with his wife and 19-year-old daughter in a house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His daughter attends the university while Davaasuren and his wife operate a meat retail business in their town. They began their business in 2000 with working capital of 200,000 tugrugs. They became quite successful and soon began selling their meat products in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where they can charge higher prices than in the countryside. He is well known amongst both his customers and suppliers as an intelligent and responsible businessman. Since beginning his business, he has been able to purchase a piece of land and build a house on it for his family. He would eventually like to be able to purchase a truck for his business. Davaasuren is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more meat in order to keep expanding his business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more meat.

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn P. is the group leader of four who all live in Trapeang Khchau village in Takeo province. She raises pigs. Since her pig business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets to raise to earn more income.

Mrs. Chorn P. is 47 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Pao Nguon, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from farming this plantation, he is also a laborer.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Jamsran

texts.en:
Jamsran B. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in Gobi-Altai province in southern Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and his three daughters all attend a local secondary school. B. operates a welding business in his town. His main work is making metal repairs and fixing machinery parts. B. started his welding business in 2004 and has found success in his trade. When he started his business he mainly worked out of his home, but his earnings over the years have enabled him to rent a comfortable room where he now conducts his business. B. is working hard to grow his business and has many plans for the future. He says, "I want to own the room that I am renting now and I hope to build a house for my family." He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to help him purchase the workspace that he now rents. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To help him purchase the workspace that he now rents

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 50 years old and married with six school-age children. She runs the Furaha Primary School in Kiambu. She opened the school in 2008 and employs three people. She describes herself as ambitious and hopes to expand the school to include a secondary school in the future.

She requested this loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu to buy school stationery and build a classroom. She says that in Faulu she has also learnt how to save money.

loans.use: Buy school stationery & build a classroom

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Yat B. is the group leader of four who all live in Ta Skor village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows vegetables.

Mr. Yat B.’s wife, Mrs. Kong Neang, is a fruit seller. The couple has two children, one of whom is a fruit seller while another is too young to work or study.

Now Mr. Yat B. is requesting a loan to buy more fruit to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for his wife to resell

loans.name: Ichel

texts.en: Ichel M. is from the village of Lower Irasan. She is 23 years old and is engaged. Ichel owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members such as motor cab for passengers. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ichel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Ichel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase grocery stocks for her new sari-sari (variety) store business. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for her new sari-sari store

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 44-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Khalil has been working as a hairdresser since 2004. He also offers beauty products and beauty treatments like manicure and pedicure, hair removal, and makeup. Khalil requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase beauty products for his salon. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work, and consequently his financial situation. 
Khalil is special in his work because he knows how to treat his client and is open every day of the week, even during holidays. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khalil decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening a second salon.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 38 years old and divorced with three children who are  four, six, and ten years old. He runs the D. Communication Network, providing a television reception service to neighboring houses. He's been in this business since 2005 and employs two people. He describes himself as ambitious, simple, and determined to work. He completed a previous loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000. He says that in Faulu he has learned how to save and is now able to purchase things he never thought of.

He requested this loan for Kes. 40,000 from Faulu to buy more machines and start another business in a different location. He hopes to expand his business and own his own house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more machines

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basam is a 39-year-old Palestinian woman. She lives in Al-Khader village near Bethlehem but works in Hebron city as a messenger in the Ministry of Social Affairs. She lives with her sister who also works as a clerk. They are both single and live alone after their parents passed away.

Basma has diabetes that affects her eyes. She needs surgery ASAP and needs the money for this surgery, so she has requested 2,000 USD from FATEN.

Basma appears in the photo at the FATEN office.

loans.use: To pay for her eye surgery

loans.name: Srey Pao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Pao T. is the group leader of four members who all live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns 4-hectare (10-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

In this plantation, Mrs. Srey Pao T. faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She will use the rest of money to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

Mrs. Srey Pao T. is 33 years old and is a widow with two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field

loans.name: Rysala

texts.en:
Rysala is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Rysala has been working in sewing since 2002. Rysala is special in her work because she is known for her good and talented work. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time. 

When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Rysala decided on doing her business because of her experience; when she was younger, she used to sew in a shop. In the future, she plans on expanding her work by opening a shop and showing her clothing designs.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her work

loans.name: Nonvissidé

texts.fr: A. Nonvissidé est née en 1980 à Adja au Mono au Bénin. C’est une célibataire qui réside depuis huit ans au quartier Zounga à Abomey Calavi, non loin de Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Nonvissidé n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Nonvissidé s’est mise à vendre depuis 8 ans déjà, des tissus et également des chaussures à Cococodji et à Pahou, non loin de Cotonou. Nonvissidé s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Nonvissidé a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Afin d’agrandir davantage son activité et de faire face à la forte demande de la clientèle surtout en ces périodes de fêtes, Nonvissidé sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Nonvissidé ambitionne louer une boutique pour faire écouler ses tissus.
texts.en:
A. Nonvissidé was born in 1980 in Adja in Mono, in Benin.  She is unmarried and has been residing for eight years in the Zounga district in Abomey Calavi, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Nonvissidé never attended school.  In order to support herself, she got started selling cloth and also shoes eight years ago in Cococodji and in Pahou, not far from Cotonou.  She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She once obtained an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid.  To expand her business further and to cope with the strong customer demand, especially during these holidays, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  Her ambition is to lease a shop to sell off her fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of cloth and some shoes to sell

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
S. is a 54-year-old widowed mother of a grown daughter who lives in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. She lives by herself in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and operates a grocery business in her town. She began her business in 1997 with the help of her daughter, but since then her daughter has moved away with her own family, S. operates the business on her own now. She attributes her business’ success to the accounting skills she learned while at university and hopes to keep growing her business in the future. She says, “I get a pension, but I conduct my business in order to save money for my children and grandchildren.” S. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more groceries for her shop. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en: Khachatur B. was born in 1968 in Kapan. He graduated from the Technological Institute in St. Petersburg. He is married and has three children: two school-aged daughters and a 2-year-old son. Now Khachatur is a superintendent of the school in Verin Khotanan village, Kapan area. And his wife works in the same school as a librarian. Khachatur, having been a school superintendent, has engaged in bee-keeping and he owns 25 bee-families. The first part of the day Khachatur spends at school and after dinner he is busy with his bees. Every month he has approximately 50.000 AMD income from bee-keeping. Khachatur is requesting a 400.000 AMD loan to increase the quantity of bee-families. In the photo you can see Khachatur with one of his daughters.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of bee-families

loans.name: Souzan

texts.en: Souzan is a 25-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Souzan has owned a beauty lounge for almost two years now. She does makeup, manicure and pedicure, hair removal and lots more. Souzan is special in her work because she knows how to please her clients and she is talented in her work. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a laser machine for work. This is the first time that Souzan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Souzan decided on doing her business because of her experience. Before she opened her beauty lounge, she used to work in one. In the future, she plans on expanding her work by opening another beauty lounge.

loans.use: To purchase a laser machine for work.

loans.name: Mrs. Youren Say Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people, who are all living in Prek Ta Ker village in Kandal province, make up this village bank loan. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Youren S. is 28 years old and single and she is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates both rice and vegetables.

Mrs. Youren S. faces an obstacle with her plantation because she does not have enough money to grow rice on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy farming supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her farm

loans.name: Barq Group

texts.en:
This is Barq Group. Muhibullah, an educated man with ample experience in his work, is the leader of Barq Group. He is 24 years old, married, and the father of 6 children: 4 sons and 2 daughters. He is in the business of selling fuel. Currently, his business income is not enough to satisfy his family's needs and wants. Therefore, he wants to expand his business capacity to make a larger profit and increase his business income.

Abdul Mateen is the second member of Barq Group. He is an expert in his field. He wants to get a loan to buy wood and enlarge his business. The third member of this group is Naseerullah, who has a business selling mobile phone cards. Through the income from this business, he supports the 7 members of his family.

They have requested a group loan of 15,000 Afghani to expand their businesses and they have met the requirements to receive this loan. They would like to say many thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Baatarhuu

texts.en:
Baatarhuu B. is a 34-year-old single mother who lives with her two young sons in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her sons live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest son is seven years old and attends a local secondary school. Her youngest is five years old and will soon start school. B. manages a hair salon in her town. She started her business in 2008 with capital of 50,000 tugurgs after working as a hairdresser for two years in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She graduated from a hairdressing course in 2000 and has gained much experience as a hairdresser over the years. Her salon has been successful in its first year of operation. B. has quickly grown her business and built a positive repution among her many customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 500,000 tugrugs. B. hopes to continue to grow her business in the future and continue to provide excellent service to her customers. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tools and materials used in hairdressing. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials used in hairdressing

loans.name: Mmpaebo Group

texts.en:
Mavis is a 43-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three kids who are currently in school. She prepares and sells local food like fufu with bush meat. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. With her tasty meals, she has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves. Therefore, it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food delivery service. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Mmpaebo’, which means prayer. She is the one sitting in middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Mrs. Nat Horm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of seven people, is located in Trabaek Pok village in Kandal province. All of the group's members will use the loan proceeds for different purposes.

Mrs. Nat H., for example, is the village bank president. She is a grocer, who owns a small grocery store. Because her business has been doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products; in turn, she expects to re-sell more of her goods and to generate an increase in her income. Mrs. Nat H. is 39 years old, and she is the mother of three children. One of her children is a laborer, while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional groceries for resale purposes

loans.name: Laurance

texts.en:
Laurance is a 29 year old man who lives in Beirut, the Capital of Lebanon. Laurance has been working as a taxi driver since 2006. Laurance requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Laurance has requested a loan.

Laurance is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is punctual. His clients are his friends, neighbors and passers-by. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Laurance decided on doing this business because he used to work as a private driver. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by owning several cars and then renting them.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 36 years old and married with two teenage children. She has a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in business for two years and employs one person. She describes herself as hardworking and determined. She requested this loan for Kes. 80,000 from Faulu to invest in her business.

In the future, Winfred would like to buy a plot of land and build her own home. She would also like to expand her business to have a larger exhibition shop. She says that in Faulu she has learnt how to save.

loans.use: Add stock of used clothes

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two sons, 17 and 11, both attend a local secondary school and her husband mines for gold. Davaasuren operates a clothing retail business in her town where she imports products from China and sells the items at the local market. She started her business in 2003 with working capital of 600,000 tugrugs (~420 USD) and at first she had difficulty importing her merchandise, but now she has both reliable customers and suppliers. Now her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2100 USD) and she has managed to buy a car for her family with her business’ profits. She says, “I work hard in order to save money for my children’s education.” Davaasuren is requesting a 1,550,000 tugrug (~1090 USD) loan in order to import more products from China. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To import more products from China.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Lina has been working as a seamstress since 2004. She repairs all type of clothes. Lina is special in her work because she does it well and knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine for work. Lina has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Lina decided on doing her business because of her experience; she has been sewing since a young age. In the future, she plans on expanding her work by opening a sewing factory.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for work

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
