Hanan is married with two children. Her husbend used to work in Israel but after the closure he helps her in her business.

Hanan established her workshop six years ago and currently has three workers in addition to herself and her husband. The sewing workshop is the only source of income for the family. She buys the cloth and sews it. She appears in the photo at her business.

Hanan has approached FATEN for 1,500 USD to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and thread

location.town: Taqou' Village, Bethlehem City, West Bank

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en: Wahida is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Wahida has been selling clothes from her house since 1999. Wahida is special in her work because she sells good quality clothes and has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is her second cycle, and she has always paid on time. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Wahida decided on doing her business because she wanted to be financially independent. In the future, she plans on expanding her work by purchasing a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mr. Sor S. is a 40-year-old married man, living with his wife and eight children in Tuol Doun Kam village in Kandal province. Five of his children are enrolled in the local school, while the other children are too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Chea Sae, is pictured in the photograph with him.

He and his wife are farmers; more specifically, they own a plot of land, on which they cultivate rice and lotus. They face an obstacle with their rice-cultivation business in that they do not have sufficient capital to buy farming supplies for growing rice. Thus, Mr. Sor S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline (to pump water to support the rice field).

loans.use: To improve the business by purchasing rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Sanaa has owned a chocolate shop since 2004. She offers chocolate designs for celebrations, souvenirs, birth gifts, marriage gifts, etc. Sanaa is special in her work because she does very nice chocolate designs and has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase accessories for chocolate design. This is her second cycle, and she has always paid on time. When she first started her business, she had financial issues in purchasing as much as she needed. Sanaa decided on doing her business because of her experience and her like of that work. In the future, she plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for chocolate design

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en:
Densmaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two youngest children, 18 and 12 attend a local school and her oldest daughter, 23, helps her operate her clothing retail business. She started her business in 2009.  Densmaa has also run a door to door meal delivery business for four years. She is a very hard worker and has a great personality.  She says, “I want to be able to educate my children and help them lead happy lives.”  Densmaa is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~$560 USD) loan to purchase more clothing for her business.
------------------------------
About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Samnang Orn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people, all of whom live in Kong Noy village in Kandal province. Mrs. Samnang O., who has been selected by the other members as the village bank president, is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Both of her children are enrolled in the local school.

Mrs. Samnang O. makes and sells soup to generate income. Her husband, Mr. Lat Chork, is a farmer, who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. She is now applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to increase her income and thereby improve her family's standard of living by selling the cow.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding purposes

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is a 40-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Abed has been selling fish and aquariums since 2001. Abed requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fish food for his work. This is his second cycle, and he has always paid on time. Abed is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues. Abed decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase fish food for his work

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Sunny A. I. is 64 years old and married with four children. Two of his children are graduates and the other children are undergraduates. His wife assists him in his business. He has a poultry farm where he raises birds to sell. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for a loan amount of 170,000 NGN to purchase more birds. This is the high season for his business, and he hopes to make more profits. He is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Laure Damienne

texts.fr: Z. Laure Damienne est née le 14 Avril 1969 et réside depuis une douzaine d’année à Cocotomey à Abomey Calavi, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Laure Damienne est mariée à KODJO Elie. Le couple a quatre enfants en charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants et sont scolarisés. Laure Damienne vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les deux conjoints supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Laure Damienne a arrêté très tôt l’école, et il y a 20 ans de cela qu’elle exerce la couture. Laure Damienne vend également des articles de mercerie dans son atelier à Cocotomey. Laure Damienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Laure Damienne a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Laure Damienne souhaiterait réunir suffisamment de fonds pour aller s'approvisionner au Nigéria et agrandir sa boutique. C'est pourquoi Laure Damienne sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Laure Damienne Z. was born on 14 April, 1969, and has lived for a dozen years in Cocotomey in Abomey Calavi, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Laure Damienne is married to Elie Kodjo. The couple have four children in their care, of whom two are their own and are in school. Laure Damienne lives with her husband and children. Both husband and wife provide for the family. Laure Damienne stopped her education very early on, and for the past 20 years she has been a dressmaker. Laure Damienne also sells sewing items in her workshop in Cocotomey. Laure Damienne gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and in Nigeria, a country bordering Benin. Laure Damienne has already benefited from one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. Laure Damienne hopes to gather enough funds to go and get supplies in Nigeria and enlarge her shop. This is why Laure Damienne is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of various kinds of buttons, satin, and linings

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Elizabeth owns a women's clothing shop. She also sells women's accessories and shoes. Elizabeth is exceptional in her work because she offers a wide range of products. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.

She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes and shoes for her shop. Elizabeth has been a micro-credit client for six years now and has always paid on time. When she first started her business, she had no problems. Elizabeth decided on opening her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita V. is from the village of Miputak. She is 47 years old, is widowed, and has five children, four of whom are adult and the youngest is school-aged. Anecita owns and operates a business running a retail stall, selling a variety of agricultural produce and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and married with five children. All her children are currently in school. She supports her husband in taking care of the children through the sale of bush meats (any wild animal species). She has in stock deer, grass cutters (cane rats) and the likes. She takes delivery of meat from the surrounding villages and supplies to local restaurant operators. She wants the loan to buy a stock of meat in bulk.
 
She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Unity’. She is the one sitting second from the left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bush meats in bulk for a supply to sell.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena cooks and sells fufu (a dumpling eaten w/soup or stew). Fufu is gotten from fermented cassava (also "manioc", the root is similar to potato). It can be eaten with local soup like ‘egusi’ (based on ground melon seeds) or ‘ogbono’ (based on ground ogbono seeds). The demands for her fufu is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers during and after the high season. She is 47 years old and married with four children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more cassava to cook more fufu to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more fufu to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Alice has owned a clothing shop since 2004. Alice is notable in her work because she offers competitive prices. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.

She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

When she first started her business, she had no problems. Alice decided on opening her business because she wanted to have independent work and be financially independent. In the future, she plans to expand.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Dolgormaa is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 15-year-old daughter in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the city. Her daughter attends a local secondary school, while her husband runs a transportation business and Dolgormaa owns a used clothing retail business. She began her business in 2003 and her dream is to one day buy an apartment in the city so that her family can be more comfortable. There is a large market for used clothing in Mongolia, as many people do not have the resources to purchase new clothing. Dolgormaa is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) loan in order to purchase more used clothing to sell during the winter months.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell during the winter months.

loans.name: Mr. Chantha Sin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty people and they all live in Chey Otdom village in Takeo province. Mr. Chantha S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He owns a small restaurant which sells items such as coffee, Chinese noodles with soup, and so on.

Since his business is going well, he wants to make soup that tastes more delicious. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make soup. His wife, Mrs. Khut Sokha, is a farmer who owns a 3 hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Chantha S. is 39 years old and the father of seven children, two of whom are car cleaners while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make soup.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Nada has owned a shoe shop since 1996, having embarked on the business as a way to supplement her family's income. Nada is special in her work because she offers nice, fashionable and comfortable shoes to her clients, who are her friends and neighbors. Her previous loans helped her to increase and diversify her merchandise, and she is now requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase shoes for her shop. Nada has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for her shop.

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en:
Patriciah is 27 years old and lives in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She is married to a clerk on the town council and they have one school-age child. Patriciah works as a green grocer. She sells greens and fruits to residents in her area and has been in business for two years. Her loan is for Kes. 20,000 and she will use the funds to buy more fruits and greens.

She describes herself as outgoing and funny.  She hopes to become a teacher and grow her grocery business so she can serve the entire town.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells loaves of bread at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo state. She also has a game house where her customers come to play in the evenings. She hopes to own a cinema in the future. With the combined businesses, she is able to meet her family’s basic needs. She is 46 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a contractor. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase one television set and loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase a television and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Dopé Aimée

texts.fr: Marié et mère de 04 enfants, cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de trousseau bébé, thermos, biberons et autres choses de bébé. Elle dresse son étalage de marchandises dans le marché local de hedzranawoé. Voulant agrandir son stock, elle  sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 trousseaux bébés, 10 thermos et une vingtaine de biberons.
texts.en:
Married with four children, this lady runs a business retailing babies' clothing, thermos flasks, babies' bottles, and other baby items. She sets up her display of merchandise at the local market in Hedzranawoé. Wanting to increase her stock, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 25 babies' outfits, 10 thermos flasks, and twenty babies' bottles.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy babies' clothing, thermos flasks, and babies' bottles

loans.name: Evelyn Akoua

texts.fr: Cette femme a commencé en 1999 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a commencé ce commerce en 1999, elle a ouvert sa boutique à domicile. Son stock s’épuise et elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire tous ses clients. Pour ne pas perdre sa clientèle, elle doit se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs moyens de riz, 25 boîtes de conserve de tomates, 8 bidons d’huile de palme et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This woman started a business in 1999 selling general food products. She began this business in 1999 and opened a store in her home. Her stock is depleted and she is unable to satisfy all of her customers. To keep from losing customers, she needs to resupply herself, which is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 20 medium-size bags of rice, 25 cans of tomatoes, 8 drums of palm oil, and various other general food products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing sells medicines at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo. She is friendly, hard working and determined to excel in her business and family life. She is 25 years old and married with a child. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell.  She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en:
Dorjpalam, 51, lives with his wife and two of his three children in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His oldest son, 27, works and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia and his two younger children, 24 and 18, both attend university.  With the help of his wife, Dorjpalam operates a grocery and dairy retail business in their town.  They started it in 2003 by renting a stall at a local market.  With years of hard work and success they build their own shop where they conduct business.  Dorjpalam and his wife have a lot of business experience.  He says, “All I want to do is help my children to become good people.” Dorjpalam is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1400 USD) loan to purchase more dairy and grocery products for his shop.
------------------
About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: Purchase more dairy and grocery products for his shop.

loans.name: Manoushak

texts.en: Manoushak is a 62 year old woman who lives in Beirut, Lebanon with her husband. Manoushak has owned a clothing shop since 2006. Manoushak's work is exceptional because she offers nice and fashionable clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She is currently requesting a loan from Al Majmoua so that she can purchase more merchandise for her shop. Manoushak has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her increase and diversify her merchandise. Manoushak decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. Before opening her shop she used to sell from her house.

loans.use: purchasing more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: A. K.  Yvette est née le 17 Janvier 1969 à Comé au Bénin. Yvette est mariée à AGBANTE Sévérin. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés ; La famille vit depuis 8 ans à Cocotomey à Abomey Calavi, non loin de Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Yvette et Sévérin supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Yvette n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est depuis douze ans que Yvette vend des oreillers et également de la tisane (médicament traditionnel fait à base de feuilles) à Cocotomey. Yvette fait ses achats à Pahou au Bénin et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Yvette a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé et l’a bien remboursé. C’est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir son activité, que Yvette sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Yvette A. K. was born on 17 January, 1969 in Comé, Benin. Yvette is married to Sévérin Agbante. The couple have four children who are all in school; for 8 years, the family has lived in Cocotomey in Abomey Calavi, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Yvette and Sévérin provide for the family together. Yvette never went to school. For twelve years, Yvette has been selling pillows and traditional herbal medicine made from leaves in Cocotomey. Yvette makes her purchases in Pahou, Benin and at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Yvette has already benefited from one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid it properly. It is to augment her working capital and to enlarge her business that Yvette is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pillows and bags of leaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nwakwabel

texts.en: Nwakwabel is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Delta State, Nigeria and sells food. Nwakwabel intends to expand her business in future. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of N 150,000 so that she can purchase more food to sell. Nwakwabel is a committed LAPO client. She hopes to be able to increase her earnings in the long run and thus be able to provide for her children's education. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more food to sell

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur n’a pas fait de grandes études, très tôt il a appris la menuiserie, après sa formation, il a ouvert en 2001 son propre atelier dans son quartier. Il fabrique lui-même des meubles qu’il vend à ses clients. Il expose les meubles devant son atelier pour attirer le regard des passants.  Il a reçu des commandes de ses clients qu’il ne peut exécuter parce que ne disposant pas suffisamment de planches, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 30 planches et divers matériaux.
Il est marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges des sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman did not have an extensive education; very early on he learned to be a carpenter. In 2001, after his training, he opened his own workshop in his area. He makes furniture himself that he sells to his customers. He displays his furniture in front of his workshop to attract the attention of passersby. He has received orders from his customers that he cannot execute because he does not have enough planks of wood; he is thus seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 30 planks and various other materials. He is married and has two children. It is with the income from his business that he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks of wood and accessories

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 25-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Sami has been working as a hairdresser since 2005. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Sami is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is aware of new hairstyles. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience; before opening his saloon, he used to work as an employee in another saloon. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Enkhtur lives with his wife in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is pregnant and stays at home while Enkhtur operates a taxi service. Enkhtur began driving a taxi in 2007 and paid 33,000 tugrugs (~23 USD) per day in rental fees for a car to drive. Since then, he has managed to save enough money to not only buy his own car in order to operate his business, but he also managed to build his own house. He would like to keep earning more profit so that he can improve his growing family’s living standards. Enkhtur is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase repair parts for his taxi. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. Rania has owned a grocery store since 2001. She has been selling candies, canned food, home cleaning products and lots more. Rania is special in her work because she has a big variety of merchandise. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. 

When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Rania decided on doing her business because she wanted to have independent work and she also wanted to supplement her husband's income. In the future, she plans on expanding the store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Belia

texts.en: Maria Belia is 38 years old.  She and her husband have a 10-year-old child.  Being a rice farmer, Maria believes that hard work is a must to succeed. Despite past failures, she is still eager to do her best to reap an income from her farm. She has sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines. She applied for a loan of PHP 11,000, which she will use to purchase the fertilizers and other items needed at her farm.

loans.use: Fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 31 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. She has been selling children’s clothing from her house since 1997.  Her clients are her family members, friends and neighbors. 

Samia settled on this business because she wanted to be independent in her work and also to supplement her husband’s income. When she first started her business, Samia had some financial issues and couldn’t purchase a lot of merchandise. Now, however, she is special in her field because she owns a large variety of merchandise. 

Samia has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for her business. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.  In the future, she plans on expanding by opening a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a rice farmer. She is 51 years old and a resident of Agusan Del Sur, where rice farming is one of the main livelihoods. She tills her 1-hectare rice field with patience and diligence. She makes sure not to let weeds grow on her farm so her crops can grow healthy.

Mary Ann joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2008. She likes its program and thinks its financial services are truly helpful to farmers like her. She applied for a loan of PHP 11, 000, which will help her buy sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies she needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a more diverse range of products to offer to his clients

loans.name: Kervy

texts.en: Kervy is a young mother to two children. She is 23 years old and her oldest child is only 2 years old. She has been married to her husband Ronnie since 2007. Living in Agusan Del Sur, she maximized her resources and taught herself farming. She plants rice on her field and always aims for an abundant and high-quality harvest. According to her, her rice farm needs additional capital. She has applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of PHP11,000. With this loan, she will buy fertilizers and all the necessary supplies for her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Macheru

texts.en:
Macheru is 50 years old and married with three children. His wife works as a civil servant and his children are all attending school.

Macheru runs a hardware business selling building materials to developers and has been in business for ten years. He also earns some income from a rental property. His loan is for Kes 50,000 and he will use the funds to purchase more building materials.

Macheru describes himself as hardworking and says that, in the future, he would like to become self-reliant and a leading hardware supplier in his town of Kitengela and in the surrounding area.

loans.use: To add to his stock of building materials

loans.name: Safwan

texts.en:
Safwan is a 35-year-old man who lives with his wife and their four children in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon.

Safwan works as a taxi driver and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and to pay for his wife’s medication. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time.

Safwan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is punctual. His clients are his friends, neighbors and passers-by. When he first started his business, he had difficulty buying his car number plate since it cost a lot. He decided on doing his business because he had to find work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his taxi and to pay for his wife's medication

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
59-year-old Freddie works hard for his family. He is a rice farmer and loves spending time at his farm. He makes sure his land is in good condition so his crops are able to grow healthy.

In need of additional capital, Freddie joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain its financial services. He applied for a loan of Php 12,000 which he will use to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and other inputs needed at his farm. Receiving this loan will be truly helpful to Freddie’s farming.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Vinadel

texts.en: Vinadel C.  is 36 years old and married. She has five children; her oldest is seventeen years old. She is a rice farmer. Vinadel joined CEVI in September 2008. The growth of her farm has been because of the financial support she has received. Now she is requesting a loan of Php11, 000. Vinadel will use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies that she lacks. She hopes that this loan will help her in achieving her goal of expanding her business.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Norie

texts.en: Norie B. is a single parent of an 8-year-old child. She is 36 years old and a rice farmer. Like other farmers, she has observed that one of the major factors in achieving a quality harvest is proper financing. Because Norie lacks financial support for her farm, she joined CEVI, a microfinance organization in the Philippines and a KIVA partner. She has applied for a loan of Php11, 000 and will use the loan to purchase farm supplies and also to pay for the laborers who help on her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: I. is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a flower shop called "Best Flowers" since 2008. He has 10 years of experience in this field. He services the neighboring villages with beautiful flowers and designs. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 to expand his shop and purchase additional merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 34 year old man who lives in Beirut, Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Yousef has been selling fruits and vegetables since 1989. He sells all types of fruits and vegetables depending on the season. Yousef has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him expand his stock and diversify his merchandise.  
Yousef is special in his work because he offers good quality products and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase a variety of merchandise. In the future, Yousef plans on improving his business by continuing to diversify and by offering more merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz D. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 61 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Beatriz owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Beatriz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She wants to improve the house she lives in. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune célibataire et très dynamique, pour subvenir à ses charges il a mobilisé ses ressources pour ouvrir son propre atelier  de vente de matériaux informatiques qu’il a appelé «  INTER-CONTACT », il fait également dans sa boutique le traitement de texte de même que la vente de téléphones portables. Son stock étant en baisse, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers matériels informatiques et des portables.
texts.en:
This young gentleman is unmarried and very dynamic. To provide for himself, he mobilized his resources to open his own shop selling computer equipment, which he has named "Inter-Contact." In his shop, he also does word processing and sells cellphones. His stock being low, he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy various computer equipment and cellphones.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer equipment and cellphones

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with 4 children. Her children are excelling in school. Joy sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers.This  is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. Joy hopes to own a super market in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Galhuu

texts.en: Galhuu is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his sons, 17 and 10, attend a local secondary school while Galhuu and his wife operate a raw materials business. He sells goat and sheep skins, which he purchases from the countryside and transports to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He began his business in 2000, and since then he has developed relationships with customers and suppliers that he trusts. He says, “Hard work is the one thing that makes a person’s life better.” Galhuu is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more skins so that he can increase his sales and profits. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more skins and raw material

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy, 32 years old, is a diligent farmer. He is married and has two children. His oldest child is only four years old. He plants rice on his farm and gives his best in doing so. He wants to save for his children’s future. He joined CEVI in 2008 to help with his lack of capital. Now he is requesting a loan of PHP11,000 to be used for seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs he needs. This loan will truly be a big help in Jimmy’s farming.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en: Nathalie is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of one child. In 2000, she decided to open a clothes shop as her own business to earn additional income for the household. Today, Nathalie is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy more clothes in order to augment her sales and make a good income for the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: 54-year-old Jessie has been married to her husband Edwin for nearly 15 years now. She has one child with him who is 19 years old. Jessie is into rice farming. Like other farmers, her goal is to achieve a quality harvest. She gives her best in farming because it is where she gets income for her family. She sought the help of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She applied for a loan of PHP10,000, which she will use to buy farm inputs, like fertilizers and seeds, for her farm. Hopefully, this loan will really be useful in achieving Jessie’s goal.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Inatulo

texts.en:
Inatulo is an excellent father of four children and a farmer who is dedicated to his work. His goal is to better his farming techniques. That way he fulfills the needs of his home, especially for his children. He sows corn, onion and potato with the help of his sons. Inatulo travels daily without delay to his agricultural lands and is aware of every change that occurs. Due to high demand for his products because of their excellent quality, size and flavor, Inatulo has decided to plant more and apply for a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers that will contribute to an excellent harvest. With this, Inatulo will be able to increase his sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of his dearest children. Your support will really help him.  
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en: Mariza is a 36-year-old married woman. She has four children. The oldest is 11. She is a rice farmer and works hard for her family. She makes sure she can send her kids to school everyday. She wants all her kids to finish college and find a decent job. Her 1-hectare rice field is her sole source of income, so she exerts extra effort to ensure her farm is in good condition. She also joined CEVI to help her in her need for capital. She requested a loan of PHP11,000. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and other necessary inputs for her farm. This loan will help Mariza get a better income out of her farm and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: A. Florence est née le 16 Mars 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Florence est mariée à MEBOUNOU Elie, un commerçant. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Florence vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint à Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou, depuis quatre ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. C’est depuis quatre ans que Florence vend des régimes de bananes et également le maïs à son domicile et aussi au marché de Cococodji. Florence s’approvisionne au Nord du Bénin. Florence n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé.  C’est pour augmenter le volume de ses articles et satisfaire plus sa clientèle que Florence sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Florence A. was born on 16 March, 1967, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Florence is married to Elie Mebounou, a shopkeeper. The couple have four children, all in school. Florence has lived together with her children and her husband in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou, for four years. The couple meet the household expenses together. For four years, Florence has sold bunches of bananas as well as maize at her home and also at the Cococodji market. Florence gets her supplies in northern Benin. Florence has never obtained any loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). It is to increase the volume of her business and to better satisfy her clientele that Florence is seeking her first loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bunches of bananas and 4 bags of maize

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Cette dame très dynamique exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. Elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local d’adawlato. La période des fêtes étant proche, elle veut gonfler son stock pour pouvoir mieux vendre et augmenter ses profits. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 40 pagnes HI-TARGET, 20 pagnes SUPER-WAX, 25 pagnes SOSO.
Elle est mariée, elle apporte une contribution financière à son foyer grâce à son commerce
texts.en:
This very dynamic lady runs a revenue-generating activity selling pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth). She runs her business at the local market in Adawlato. With the holiday season approaching, she wants to increase her stock to be able to sell more and increase her profits. She is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 40 Hi-Target pagnes, 20 Super-Wax pagnes, and 25 Soso pagnes. She is married, and contributes financially to her household thanks to her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth)

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a married woman with five children. She has been working as a tailor since 1988. She produces a variety of products for her clientele. Over the years, she was able to help her husband take care of the house and the needs of her children. Today, Amale is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and married with four children between 11 and 25 years old. He sells second-hand clothes and has operated the business since 1995. Previously, he was a distributor of soda and snacks. He is requesting a loan for Kes. 50,000 to buy three bales of used clothes. 
In the future, Joseph would like to further expand his business and keep saving so that he can buy a plot of land for his family. He describes himself as hardworking and goal-oriented.

loans.use: To buy three bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labour

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is only 19 years old. At her young age, she is now married and has a one-year-old child. She also learned how to farm properly because as she said, she has to earn for her family. She cultivates her land for rice crops. She currently needs farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She also asked some laborers to help till the farm.

Daisy joined CEVI and requested a loan of PHP7,000. With this loan, she can now buy the farm inputs she needs and she can pay the laborers who helped her.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay the laborers

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: Osas is 42 years old and married with five children. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells groceries and cooked foods. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She hopes to own a restaurant in the future. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis, 34 years old, is a rice farmer. He is married and has four kids and his oldest child is only twelve years old.

Dennis learned farming from his parents and the land he is tilling now was also inherited. He works hard to maintain the farm because it is his only source of income.

Dennis joined CEVI to obtain its financial services so that he could support his farm. He applied for a loan of Php 10,000 which he will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. He will also be able to pay the laborers at his farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and to pay laborers

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en: Tarek is a single man living with his parents. He is 27 years old, and he has been supporting his family already for 12 years since he started working in a barber shop at a very young age.  He is the only provider for his parents. In 2007 he decided to open his own barber shop called “Tarek shop” so he could improve his income. Today, Tarek is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a vapor machine.

loans.use: To buy a vapor machine.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn A. enjoys farming. She is 34 years old and married. She plants rice and tends to her crops with care so they stay healthy, and makes sure not to let weeds grow. Seeking financial assistance, she applied to CEVI and requested a loan of PHP 11, 000 which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs necessary for Evelyn to produce a quality harvest. She will also pay the laborers she hired to work at her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Hoinveli

texts.fr: ce monsieur est marié, pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa femme, il a entamé en 2005 le commerce de matelas et de tissus de fauteuils, sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour et ceci grâce à la qualité de ses produits. Voulant augmenter son stock  pour mieux vendre, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 5 matelas et 70 mètres de tissus de fauteuils.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married. To provide for himself and his wife, he started a business involving mattresses and fabrics for armchairs in 2005. His customer base grows from day to day, thanks to the quality of his products. Wanting to increase his inventory in order to sell more, he's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 5 mattresses and 70 meters of armchair fabric.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mattresses and armchair fabrics

loans.name: Ganzaya

texts.en:
Ganzaya is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and Ganzaya operates a taxi service in his town. He began his business in 2003 and has supported his family since then with his income. He would also like to open a meat trading business in the future so that he can improve his family’s quality of life, but for now he is focused on making his taxi service more profitable and efficient. Ganzaya is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan in order to purchase repair parts and spare parts for his taxi.

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.  To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Elsielita

texts.en: Elsielita is a mother to five children. She is 34 years old and has been married for 16 years now. Her oldest child is 16. She is involved in rice farming. She ventured in this kind of business because rice is a necessity for Filipinos. Elsie strives to serve quality rice and earn income for her family. To achieve her goals, she applied to CEVI for financial assistance. She became a member and applied for a loan of PHP 11, 000 which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Roselo

texts.en: Roselo is a 31-year-old hardworking father. He has been married to Jocelyn since 2001. They have two young children and the oldest is eight years old. His source of income is rice farming. He spends enough time on his farm to ensure its good condition. His family is his inspiration in life and he wants to provide the best for them. He also wants his children to have a proper education. A member of CEVI, he applied for a loan of PHP 11, 000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs he needs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Angique

texts.en:
Angique is a 34-year-old mother. She is married to Jeffrey and they have two children.

Living in Agusan Del Sur, she has the advantage of having a livelihood as a farmer. She plants rice because it is one of the major agricultural crops there. It is also a basic need for every Filipino family. To sell quality rice, she works hard to keep her crops in good shape.

Angique has asked for financial assistance from a micro-financial institution. She applied for a loan of Php 12,000 which she will use to purchase farm inputs needed at her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 47-year-old single man. He has owned a vegetable business since 2008 with fifteen years of experience in the agriculture sector.

To attract more clients, Kamal needs a loan of $1,200 to add a glass stand where he will present the vegetables in order to increase his business income.

loans.use: To add a glass stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plowing and buying fertilizer

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 51 years old and is married with five children. Her husband is a yam seller. She believes in assisting her husband. She is very hardworking and she makes sure she has food on the table every day through her hard work.

Rose sells cooked foods, fried meat, fish and drinks to make a living. She expands her restaurant business by building. Due to increased patronage in her business, she hopes to purchase foodstuffs and drinks in large quantity which will attract discounts and increase her profit.

Rose has finished repaying her previous loan. She is requesting N150,000 that will enable her to meet her customers’ demands and increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: M. Rafiatou est née en 1966 à Sakété au Bénin. Rafiatou est mariée à RIKPOSSOU T. Jonas, un mécanicien et revendeur de pièces détachées. Rafiatou a deux enfants en charge, dont un est son propre enfant et est scolarisé. C’est depuis 6 ans que Rafiatou vit avec ses enfants au quartier Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rafiatou et Jonas supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Rafiatou n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a cinq ans de cela que Rafiatou vend des biscuits (en gros et en détail) et également des pommes à son domicile et au parc de Cococodji. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, au Nigéria et au Togo, deux pays voisins du Bénin, que Rafiatou s’approvisionne. Rafiatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Rafiatou aimerait accroître davantage son activité et construire une baraque pour la vente de ses marchandises. C’est la raison pour laquelle Rafiatou sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
M. Rafiatou was born in 1966 in Sakété in Benin. She is married to RIKPOSSOU T. Jonas, a mechanic and retailer of spare parts. She has two children to support. One of them is her own and in school. For six years, she has been living with her children in the Cococodji district, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rafiatou and Jonas support the family jointly. Rafiatou has never been to school. For five years, she has been selling cookies (wholesale and retail) and also apples out of her home and at the Cococodji parking lot. She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, from Nigeria, and from Togo (two countries neighboring Benin). She is a previous ALIDé client who has benefited from three ALIDé loans, which have been repaid. She would really like to grow her business more and to build a stall to sell her goods. These are the reasons why she's requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 boxes of cookies and 10 boxes of apples

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is a 41-year-old married woman who has two children. She cooperates with her husband to provide better life conditions for the family.

Aminah has worked as a tailor for the past fifteen years. Today, she is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase an additional sewing machine which will enable her to present a variety of products to her clientele and increase her business productivity.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Sohirdjon

texts.en: G. Sohirdjon is 52 years of age. Since he was young his father taught him to work on the land where, together, they produced wheat, corn and different kinds of vegetables. This constitutes the economic base of the settlers of Kumsangir due to the characteristic botany of the zone. For five years Sohirdjon has been dedicated to the production of corn and onions as his main economic activity and this activity has permitted his family to move forward. At present Sohirdjon is requesting a loan of $3000 USD that he will use for buying agricultural supplies in order to have a better harvest and be able to sell his crops for a better price in the market. Sohirdjon is counting on your help. He deeply appreciates the support that you are giving him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy and on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bramwel

texts.en:
Bramwel is a 40-year-old father of six children, three of whom are attending school.

Bramwel has a retail shop, selling mattresses and cushions. He's been in business since 2007 and employs two people. He previously worked at a foam mattress company. He describes himself as ambitious and says he would like to build a better life by working hard and expanding his business.

Bramwel has successfully completed one loan of Kes 20,000 through Faulu. This loan is for Kes 40,000 and he will use the funds to open a similar business in two different new locations.

loans.use: To open in two new locations

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
L. Ayush is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His son, Nyamdavaa, is 23 years old and currently serves in the Mongolian military. Ayush manages a dairy trading business in his town. He sells a variety of dairy products at the local market. Ayush started his business in 1997 with capital of 80,000 tugrugs and has built a stable operation over the years. He has gained much experience as a businessman and today his working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs . Ayush's business has provided financial stability for his family and has enabled him to improve their quality of life. He is very open-minded and is known for his good personality. Ayush hopes to expand his business in the near future. He says,"My dream is to have my own workplace and to buy a car." He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to buy dairy products to sell. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To buy dairy products to sell

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 30-year-old single man. He has owned a school bus since 2008. He presents his transportation services to the children in neighboring villages. Today Nidal is asking to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance and security on the bus.

loans.use: To perform maintenance and security on his bus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and pay for labor for growing peanuts

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 5-year-old daughter in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is an inspector at the bank of Mongolia, and Batsuren owns a retail clothing business in her town. She began her business in 2007 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs and now her working capital exceeds 2,800,000 tugrugs. Because of her business success, she has been able to improve her family’s finances and improve their quality of life. Batsuren would like to eventually own her own shop and expand her clothing offerings for her customers. She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more clothes and begin the expansion of her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and begin the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en:
A. Abdullo is a 42-year-old working man used to working the harvest from sunup to sundown. He lives in Kumsangir, Tajikistan with his wife. She is very hard-working, characteristic of the women there, and they have five children. They grow corn and onions in their field. Their work supports the family. Now they need a loan of $2800 USD because it is a crucial time for their crops. They need to be maintained so that they are high quality at harvest time. With this loan, Abdullo will be able to purchase more seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants in order to grow more vegetables. With your help, this will be possible.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 50-year-old single woman living with her mother and sister. She has owned a baby clothing shop called "White Angel" since 2006 to earn income to help satisfy their living conditions. Today, Amale is asking for a loan of $800 to buy more clothes to meet the great demand for her products.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Minet

texts.en:
Minet is 24 years old and married with two children aged 2 and 6. She has a business selling spare parts for motor vehicles. She has been in this business for three years and employs one person. She says business is very good and she hopes to open more outlets in different locations in the future.

Minet has successfully repaid four previous loans through Faulu and has requested this loan of Kes 40,000 to purchase more spare parts. She describes herself as industrious and says that since joining Faulu she changed from selling used-clothing to spare parts, which is more stable. Her dream is to own her own home in Kikuyu Town.

loans.use: To add to her stock of spare parts

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
En 2008, cette dame a commencé le commerce en détail des produits pharmaceutiques, elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa clientèle grandit tous les jours, elle veut par conséquent agrandir son stock et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 13 boîtes de paracétamol, 10 plaquettes d'artequin, 10 boîtes d'efferlagan effervescent et divers autres produits pharmaceutiques.
Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est avocat.
texts.en:
In 2008, this lady started a retail business in pharmaceutical products. She sells from place to place, and she stocks up in Lomé. Her customer base is always growing. She therefore wants to expand her stock of products and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 13 containers of paracétamol (like Tylenol), 10 blister packs of artequin (anti-malarial), 10 containers of Efferalgan Effervescent (reduces pain and fever), and a variety of other pharmaceutical products. She is married to a gentleman who is a lawyer.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a married man and the father of one child. He works as a blacksmith, producing a variety of products upon request of his clients. He has been involved in this business since 1989.

Today, Hamza is applying for a loan of $1,200 to increase his inventory and therefore his income.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and plow more land

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: A. Gulchehra is a 47-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of five children. Gulchehra is a farmer. She has land where she plants crops like wheat, onions, carrots and rice. As a rule, Gulchehra and her son, who is also engaged in her farm business, grow sufficient crops for the consumption of the family and for selling. Today, in applying to IMON for the 3,000 Somoni loan, Gulchehra hopes to produce a rich yield that she will sell in the market at prices attractive to the population. She is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength in life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sukortaity Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Sukortaity group, who are all businesspeople in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will expand their businesses to earn more sales in improve their profit margin. Consequently, their standard of living will improve. In this way, they will be able to better look after themselves and their children in terms of feeding, clothing, education, and medical needs.

The leader of this group is Aminata K. who is second from right. Aminata is approximately twenty-one years of age; she was born in a village call Banki, about eight miles from Magburaka town. Aminata is single with one child who is not of school going age.  Aminata sells fish and has been in this business for five years now. She will invest this loan into her fish business by buying cartons of quality fish. She usually buys her fish in Freetown or Makeni and sells in Magburaka town.

loans.use: To buy cartons of quality fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is a 23-year-old single man. In 2008, he decided to start his own plumbing business. After two years in this field, his business has grown remarkably so he requests to borrow $500 to purchase additionA. plumbing tools for his business.

loans.use: To buy plumbing tools.

loans.name: Khushbakht

texts.en:
A. Khushbakht is 54 years old. She is married and has a large family. She lbegan her dried fruits business to her husband with the family expenses. Since she started her business, her professional growth and development have consistently been supported through IMON’s micro-finance program. Khushbakht has repaid each loan faithfully and fully. Khushbakht has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Now her business is running successfully and it brings considerable income for her family. Today she is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase more dried fruits due to meet the great demand of her customers. Khushbakht and her family sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for processing and selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Neamat

texts.en: Since 2007, Neamat has owned a beauty salon, where she presents beauty services to the ladies in the neighboring villages. She is 33 years old.  Neamat is requesting to borrow a loan of $1,200 to purchase new tools and cosmetics products to provide good service to her clientele and earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase new tools and cosmetics products

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: P. Sylvie est née en 1948 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Sylvie vit depuis sa naissance à Gbégamey, un quartier de Cotonou. Sylvie est mariée à AKANDE, un agent du Trésor Public. Le couple a trois enfants en charge, dont un seulent est leur enfant et est scolarisé. Sylvie vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. c'est depuis 10 ans que Sylvie mène comme activité, la vente de produits de jardin, afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Sylvie vend ses produits à Gbégamey à Cotonou. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et cultiver davantage, Sylvie sollicite auprès de ALIdé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Sylive P. was born in 1948 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Since birth, she's been living in Gbégamey, a neighborhood in Cotonou. Sylvie is married to AKANDE, an employee of the Ministry of Finance. The couple has three children to support, out of whom only one is theirs and goes to school. Sylvie helps her husband with the family expenses. For 10 years, she's been selling products of her garden, in order to support her family. Sylvie sells her goods in Gbégamey in Cotonou. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loan without problems. In order to bolster her working capital and grow more, she's seeking another loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Lamia

texts.en: Lamia is a married woman who has five children. In 2001, to help her husband, she started working as a home-based tailor after 15 years of experience in this field. Over the years, she became well known by the clients and today, Lamia is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine and additional textiles.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine and additional textiles

loans.name: Tawopa Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Tawopa Sorbeh group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are applying for a loan of 2,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (or SLL 500,000 for each) for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to boost their businesses. With such a loan, their businesses will expand in size and quality. They will thus make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their standard of living will improve to a new level.

Fatmata K. (in the front) is the leader of this group. Fatmata sells dried fish and has been in this business since she was a child. With this loan, Fatmata will like to try selling rice also. She will thus use the loan to buy bags of rice and baskets full of dried fish. 

Fatmata was born in a village called Yoni, in the Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone. She now lives in Magburaka with her husband and two children. Fatmata is approximately 36 years of age. Her husband is a court clerk and her children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and baskets of dried fish

loans.name: Bekmurot

texts.en: A. Bekmurot is married, has eight children, and is a farmer. Not fortunate enough to attend school, he very early on embraced working in the fields. Due to this work, he is somehow meeting the needs of his large family. His wife and elder sons also help to support their household with his business. Today, exhausted from crude farming methods, Bekmurot brings in less and less income, which has a negative impact on his household. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to augment his crop yields. All of this will then allow him to increase his income and improve his family’s standard of living, especially his dearest children for the sake of whom he is working hard. The well being of Bekmurot’s family and his business are in your hands. Bekmurot and his family are sincerely grateful for your support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
